La Señora Rosa es socia del grupo de crédito 10 de Agosto, grupo el cual le gusta por la unión y solidaridad de todas las compañeras. Vive por la parroquia de Santa Ana en Cuenca, lugar que tiene abundante vegetación y sus verdes prados productos de la agricultura del sector, desde su centro se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo moderno y lo antiguo. Su gente es amable y gentil que aun guardan su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora Rosa tiene 42 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 6 hijos de 15, 10, 8, 6, 4 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo pasa en casa ayudando en los quehaceres y tres están estudian  en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo trabaja como jornalero, la casa en la que vive es propia.

Doña Rosa como vive en el campo se dedica a la agricultura, sus cosechas las  vende y parte utiliza para su casa, también cría cerdos, gallinas y ganado. 

Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y alimento para todos sus animales.

 Su meta es incrementar más animales y de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the loan group 10 de Agosto, a group she likes because of the closeness and solidarity of all of the colleagues. She lives in the Santa Ana parish in Cuenca, a place that has abundant vegetation, and its green fields produce the area’s agriculture. From its center one can admire a large part of the city of Cuenca. Its architecture is a mix of the modern and the old. Its people are kind and courteous, and still guard their culture and traditions.

Rosa is 42 years old. She lives in an open union and has conceived 6 children, who are 15, 10, 8, 6, 4, and 2 years old. Her first child spends time at home helping with the chores and three are studying in a small school in the area. Her husband works as a day laborer. The home in which they live is their own.

As Rosa lives in the country, she makes a living in agriculture. She sells her crops, and parts of them she uses at home. She also breeds pigs, hens, and livestock.

She is going to invest her loan in the purchase of pigs and food for all of her animals. Her goal is to have more animals and increase those of better quality.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: María Graciela

texts.es:
La Señora. María se encuentra en el grupo de crédito 10 de Agosto desde hace algún tiempo. Vive por la parroquia de Santa Ana en Cuenca, lugar que tiene abundante vegetación y verdes prados productos de la agricultura del sector, desde su centro se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo moderno y lo antiguo. Su gente es amable y gentil que aun guardan su cultura y tradiciones.


La Señora María se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos de su hogar, también a la agricultura y crianza de animales, estas actividades las aprendió de sus padres quienes le dejaron esta herencia y ahora es un trabajo que le permite solventar los gastos de su hogar y a su vez no descuidarse de su familia. 

El dinero de su crédito anterior invirtió en la compra de ganado y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca lechera. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por la unión y compañerismo de  todas las socias.
texts.en:
María has been a member of the communal bank "10 de Agosto" for some time. She lives in Santa Ana parish in Cuenca, an area known for lush vegetation, green fields, and agricultural products. From the city center, one can see most of Cuenca. Its architecture is a mix of modern and classical styles, and its friendly, polite residents preserve their culture and traditions.

María does the housework, farms, and raises livestock. She learned her trades from her parents, and this legacy lets her pay household expenses while taking care of her family. She used the previous loan to buy cattle, and she will use this loan to buy a milk cow. She likes her communal bank's unity and the camaraderie of its members.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is a 25-year-old, single man from a small village called Attel, near Tulkarem. He lives with his family in a simple, small house in the village. Husam's father is a teacher in a local school. He gets a low income which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. 

For five years, Husam has been working in beekeeping. It is very profitable work, but needs a lot of effort. Husam now owns 45 beehive boxes and he would like to increase them. This will increase his productivity and also his income. 

Husam took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy more beehive boxes for his business. 

Husam appears in the photo at his place of business.

loans.use: to buy more beehive boxes for his business.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia tiene 34 años, está casada con Hubert y vive junto a él en su casa propia. Amelia es una mujer muy empeñosa en las actividades que realiza. Desde los 20 años empezó a trabajar para mantener a su familia. Una de sus actividades es atender su negocio de venta de combustibles y lubricantes para vehículos, “la ventaja que tengo es que mi casa está cerca a la carretera, por eso siempre hay clientes que viajan por varias rutas”, menciona. A la vez cuenta con un pequeña tienda donde ofrece productos comestibles como frutas, panes, manjar blanco de leche, quesos y otros que los viajeros llevan hacia sus ciudades de origen. Los días donde tiene más ingresos son los viernes, sábados y domingos, por la mayor cantidad de autos que recorren la ciudad. Lleva como 5 años vendiendo combustibles , y dice que le va muy bien  por eso ahora requiere de su apoyo para adquirir más mercadería y no descuidar a sus clientes. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Amelia, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de combustible por galones, además de lubricantes.
texts.en:
Amelia, 34, is married to Hubert and lives with him in their own house. Amelia is committed to her businesses and began working at 20 to support her family. One of her businesses is selling gas and auto lubricants. “My advantage is that my house is next to the highway, and there are always customers traveling this road,” shes says. She also has a small grocery store, where she sells fruit, bread, caramels, cheese, and other items to travelers who wish to take them back to their hometowns. 

Her best sales days are Friday, Saturday, and Sunday, when more cars come to the city. She has been selling gas for five years and says business is good. She needs funding to buy more merchandise to service her customers. This is her fourth loan cycle with Kiva. She is grateful for the support for her business and promises to make her payments on time. Amelia will use the loan of 1000 soles to buy gasoline by the gallon and lubricants.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and auto lubricants.

loans.name: Brenda Esperanza

texts.es:
La joven Brenda  de 25 años de edad, vive con su esposo,  tiene 02 hijos que dependientes y posee casa propia, se dedica desde hace 04  años al negocio ambulante de venta de pan, rosquillas, lácteos, paletas y jugos natural.
Brenda sus clientes son los alumnos de la escuelas aledañas a su comunidad y demás vecinos y amigos que ella visita a diario, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Brenda está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de huevos, harina, maíz, leña, manteca, leche y frutas que son la materia prima para elaborar los panes y los jugos, con el apoyo de este préstamo espera suplir  la necesidad que tiene para invertir en su negocio, esta muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma. 
Brenda su sueño es seguir mejorando su casa y ampliar su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2013.
texts.en:
Brenda, 25, lives with her husband.  She has two dependent children and lives in her own house.

Brenda has made a living for four years as a street vendor selling bread, "rosquilla" pastry, dairy products, ice pops, and natural juices.  Brenda's customers are students from the schools near her community as well as other neighbors and friends whom she visits daily.  She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras.

Brenda's requesting the loan to buy eggs, flour, corn, firewood, shortening, milk, and fruits, which are the ingredients to make her breads and juices.  With the support of this loan she hopes to satisfy the need to invest in her business.  She's very happy to continue working with Prisma.

Brenda's dream is to keep on improving her house and to expand her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, August 2013

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Aletha

texts.en: Here is 55-year-old Aletha. She lives in Logan Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well known. She is single and has two children aged 15 and 35. Only one is presently in school and lives at home. She was unfortunate to complete 11th grade. She started her business with a small amount of money given to her as credit from her uncle and she managed to turn it to big one. She learned the business from other businesses who sell in the local market. She is very happy with her business because she makes a lot of profit and it provides cash for her expenses. She is proud of her business because it makes her popular. She described herself as a hardworking businesswoman. She has requested a loan to purchase more rice, oil, soap, salt, etc., for her business. Her plan is to build a decent house for her children. She thanks the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, soap, salt, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Lourdes Esthela

texts.es:
La Señora Lourdes se encuentra realizando su segundo crédito en el grupo de crédito Más que Vencedoras al cual fue invitada por una amiga. Vive en la ciudad de Azogues, lugar que por su geografía accidentada se encuentra asentada de forma inclinada, en lo más alto de la ciudad se puede observar su Catedral, su gente se dedica a elaborar artesanías, al comercio, a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Lourdes tiene 27 años, es casada y ha concebido un hijo de 2 años de edad. Su esposo es de profesión sastre, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora Lourdes se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de su hijo, también tiene en su casa en un pequeño taller de costura desde hace un año, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo, confecciona y arregla todo tipo de ropa. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de telas, hilos y lubricante para sus máquinas de coser. 

Su meta es tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Lourdes is applying for her second loan in the Más Que Vencedores Communal Bank, which she was invited to join by a friend. She lives in Azogues, a place that, due to its accidental geography, sits astride a slope. At its highest point, one can see the Cathedral. Its people engage in handicrafts, trade, livestock and agriculture. They still maintain their culture and traditions.

Sra. Lourdes is 27 years old, married and has a two year old son. Her husband is a tailor by profession and they are renters rather than home owners.

Lourdes does household tasks and cares for her little boy. She has also had a small sewing workshop in her house for one year and works from Mondays to Saturdays but does not have a fixed schedule. She makes and mends all kinds of clothing.

She will use her loan to purchase fabric, thread and lubricant for her sewing machines.

Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread and lubricant for her sewing machines.

loans.name: Maria Sabina

texts.es: María de 42 años de edad, es una mujer muy luchadora y perseverante. Vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos uno de 8, 12 y 17 años de edad, residen en casa humildad pero propia y agradece a Dios la oportunidad de ser madre ya que por ellos está dispuesta a darlo todo. María se dedica a vender verduras y frutas en un mercado local. Con tanta ilusión a ido construyendo su casa poco a poco y ésta vez desea pavimentar el corredor ya que el piso que tiene es de tierra compactada. A decidido hacer un préstamo a FUSAI para comprar cemento, grava, arena y elementos para la construcción del pavimento, espera que todo le vaya bien por el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María, age 42, is a determined and persevering woman.  She lives with her husband and three children (ages 8, 12, and 17).  They reside in a modest house that they own.  Thanks to God, she was given the opportunity to be a mother and is willing to provide everything for her children.  

María sells vegetables and fruits at the local market.  She intends to build her house a little bit at a time, so for now she wants to pave the hallway since the floor currently consists of compacted dirt.  María decided to request a loan from FUSAI so that she could buy cement, gravel, sand, and other construction materials needed to pave the floor.  She hopes that everything will go well for the sake of her children.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, sand, and other construction materials needed to pave the hallway floor.

loans.name: Josefa Antonia

texts.es:
Josefa tiene una edad de 27 años en una relación en unión libre y madre de un hijo con un grado de educación secundario completo el cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo económico brindado por sus padres. En compañía de su pareja se dedica a la agricultura siendo su especialidad el cultivo de café rubro que en su familia por muchos años ha generado la economía para mantener y cubrir las diferentes necesidades del hogar. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad ya que en su familia el rubro de la agricultura especialmente el cultivo de café es una tradición.

Ella ha decidido inyectarle un poco de capital a sus cultivos de café por medio de un financiamiento que ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de 12 QQ de fertilizante, 12 QQ de urea y 10 QQ de formula cafetalera que protegerán su cosecha de los cambios climáticos, plagas entre otros.

Sus planes a corto plazo es lograr incrementar el volumen de producción de café el cual pueda traer más ingresos para su familia ya que de esa forma ella podrá apoyar a su hijo con sus estudios y seguir formando un patrimonio para su bienestar en el futuro.
texts.en:
Josefa is 27 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of a child with a secondary education degree.  He was able to pursue the degree through financial support provided by his parents.  Along with her partner, she works in agriculture, coffee growing being their specialty.  It has been part of the family for many years and has the economy to maintain and meet the different needs of their home.  

It was her parents who taught her to work the land at a very early age, since in the area of family farming, coffee cultivation is a tradition.  She has decided to put some capital into the coffee crops through financing a loan through the COMIXMUL cooperative.  She will use this loan to buy 12 quintals of fertilizer, 12 quintals of urea, and 10 quintals of formula to protect her coffee harvest from climate change, pests and others.

Her short-term plan is to increase the volume of coffee production, which will bring more income to her family.  That way, she can support her child in their studies, and continue to form an endowment for their welfare in the future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson used the previous loan to buy another motorcycle. He has been in the motorcycle business for five years. He faces hardships of high fuel and transportation costs. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new areas and owning at least five motorcycles so he can hire some of them to other riders who will be remitting 80% of the daily earnings and also complete his residential house. Wilson intends to use the loan to buy construction materials such as sand and cement to complete his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand and cement to complete his house.

loans.name: Jeaneth

texts.es: Jeaneth, de 25 años es una mujer amable. Comenta que se casó hace poco con Ricardo con quien tiene una pequeña hija a la que cuidan en la casa de su suegra desde haca 6 años. Gracias al noble oficio de gasfitero de su esposo cubren los gastos familiares que tienen pero para poder comprarse una casa Jeaneth, comenzó a trabajar de manera independiente criando animales como ovejas y cerdos, afirma que le va muy bien en este negocio. La idea empezó cuando vió que su cuñada vendía muy bien los cerdos que poseía, entonces ella decidió criar ovejas, aúnque al principio tenía pérdidas pues vendía a sus vecinos quienes le otorgaban un bajo precio, pero conoció a una señora que compra la totalidad de sus ganados de manera semanal a buen precio, ya se convirtió en su principal clienta y para que puede negociar con empresas tiene que tener ganados de calidad, por lo que comenzará con este gran reto. Este es su primer crédito con kiva por tanto agradece su apoyo, con el cual logrará cumplir sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Jeaneth, invertirá elos S/.300 soles en la compra de comida balanceada para nutrir a sus animales.
texts.en:
Jeaneth is 25 years old and is a very friendly woman. She says she married Ricardo recently, with whom she has a young daughter who has been cared for at her mother in law's house since she was 6 years old. Thanks to the noble profession of her husband as a plumber, they have covered family expenses.  However, to buy a house, she has started to work independently, raising animals like sheep and pigs, and says she is doing very well in her business.

The idea began when she saw that her sister in law was selling pigs she owned and was doing very well.  Jeaneth decided to raise sheep, though at first she experienced losses because her neighbor sold them to her at a bad price, but she met a lady who buys all of her livestock on a weekly basis at a good price.  She became her main client but she can negotiate with companies that have better quality cattle, so this is a great challenge.  

This is her first loan with Kiva, therefore she appreciates your support, with which she can meet her objectives. One the other hand, she promises to comply with paying her dues.  Jeaneth will use the 300 soles to invest in buying balanced meal to feed her animals.

loans.use: to purchase balanced meal

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is taking a loan for her husband’s tailoring shop. Her husband is involved in a tailoring business in which he provides services of stitching clothes for his customers. He is very expert in his profession and people like his stitched clothes a lot. Her husband does not have an over-lock machine, he has to take over-lock services from another shop. To avoid additional expenses and to increase his income, he wants to buy his own over-lock machine.
Therefore, she requested a loan from Kiva’s Field Partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy an over-lock machine.
Shabana is the age of 28, living in Lahore, Pakistan, with her husband and children. 
Shabana hopes that a new over-lock machine would enhance the monthly income which becomes the cause of establishment of business and savings as well.
Shabana is very glad after taking this loan and very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a overlock machine for tailoring.

loans.name: Black Smith Development Group

texts.en:
Atanasi is a 37-year-old member of the Black Smith Development Group, married with three children aged 15, 12 and 4 and all of them attend school.
Atanasi started this job of scrap collecting twelve years ago because he did not have any working capital to start any business having dropped out of school due to lack of tuition. His daily job routine is waking up early in the morning and moving around the city in search for old metallic materials that help him in making items like charcoal stoves and saucepans that he sells to earn a living.
Atanasi loves his family and he is willing to work harder each day to provide the best life for them. He approached Ugafode Microfinance Ltd (MDI) for a loan to boost up his business by buying bigger pieces of used metal for recycling.

loans.use: To buy scrap

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a 50-year-old, married woman. She has three children, with ages ranging from 10 years to 25 years. 

Milka operates a retail store where she sells salt, soap, sugar, sweets, and other items. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her primary customers are local consumers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the transport of her stock. 

Milka will use the KES 10,000 loan to add stocks of salt, soap, sugar, sweets, and other items. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will feed her family.

loans.use: to add to her store, stocks of salt, soap, sugar, sweets, and other items.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mildred works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and reselling dried fish. Mildred is borrowing 16,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like noodles, eggs, spices, canned goods, etc. for her general store.

Mildred has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like noodles, eggs, spices, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana es una mujer de 46 años de edad, casada que de su matrimonio tiene una numerosa familia compuesta por 8 hijos los cuales 5 están en hogares a parte y 3 viven aún en su casa ya que son menores y colaboran con las diferentes actividades que se realizan en el campo al salir de sus  actividades escolares. Juntos en familia se dedican a la agricultura la siembra de café. Dichas actividades son realizadas desde hace mucho tiempo ya que fue inculcada por sus padres desde muy pequeña. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria incompleta cursada hasta el 2 grado; pero no pudo seguir estudiando ya que los ingresos que sus padres obtenían eran muy pocos. 

Doña Juana está solicitando aun financiamiento para compra 2 QQ de formula cafetalera, 2 QQ de fórmula de crecimiento, 3 QQ de fórmula 18-46-0 y 2 QQ de urea con lo que dará mantenimiento de su cultivo de café.

Ella sueña con cultivar una mejor variedad de productos en su tierra ya que ella piensa que es el patrimonio para sus hijos los cuales en compañía de su padre dan asistencia al café y que en ausencia de ellos tengan algo seguro por lo que deben de trabajar y seguir formando un patrimonio para sus hijos y las futuras generaciones.
texts.en:
Juana is a 46-year-old married woman. She has a large family from her marriage, consisting of eight children. Five of her children live on their own and three still live at home, since they are minors. They help out with the different agricultural activities when they finish school each day. 

The whole family works growing coffee crops. Juana has been doing this for a long time, since her parents taught her how to farm from a very early age. She went to primary school until the second grade, but was not able to continue studying since her parents made very little income.

Juana is asking for this loan to buy two quintals of coffee fertilizer, two quintals of growth formula, three quintals of 18-46-0 [fertilizer] and two quintals of urea, with which she will maintain her coffee crops.

She dreams of growing a greater variety of products on her land, since she thinks of this as her legacy for her children, who, along with their father, help to grow the coffee plants. She wants her children to have something secure in the absence of their parents. For this reason, she and her husband need to keep working to create an inheritance for their children and for future generations.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Zakiyeh

texts.en:
Zakiyeh is a 53-year-old Lebanese widowed woman. She is living with her three children, and all of them are still attending school. After her husband’s death, Zakiyeh became more responsible toward her family and had to work really hard to support her children well. She is a tailor, working in this type of business since 1990.

 Over the years, she was able to build a good experience and became well-known in her region. Today, Zakiyeh is in need of a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase tailoring machinery and supplies such as textiles, needles, etc. She hopes to improve her work with the aim of earning higher income to be able to enhance her children’s way of living and especially to pay their educational fees. 

Zakiyeh works from her home and she hopes to be able to own a tailoring factory one day.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring machinery and supplies such as textiles, needles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock for his bakery in bulk, e.g., baking flour, sugar, cooking fat and salt.

loans.name: Sulfecia

texts.en:
Sulfecia is 57 years old, married, and has two children. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Sulfecia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her business.

Sulfecia has been raising livestock for seven years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Sulfecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 24 years old and has two children who are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Maricel has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from fishing.

Maricel aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Tessie is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

Tessie has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Tessie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Cresilda has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Cresilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 58 years old, married, and has five children. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Virginia has been raising livestock for one year now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is 41 years old and married with five children. With one child currently in school, Vivencia works very hard to provide for her family.

Vivencia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 28,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional stock of products like snack foods, laundry soap, noodles, cooking oil, and sugar to sell in her general store.

Vivencia has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, laundry soap, noodles, cooking oil, and sugar. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of products like snack foods, laundry soap, noodles, cooking oil, and sugar to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a loan of 19,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her pumpboat. She has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her pumpboat.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a hardworking woman who lives in her own house.  It has no electricity but it does have piped water.

Fatuma sells water from her home to her neighbors and passersby.  She cites leaking pipes as her major challenge.

With a  KSH 10,000 loan she wants to purchase water pipes for her business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes for her business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana es una mujer que nació en una familia muy numerosa y eso trajo muchas restricciones para ella y sus hermanos siendo una de ellas el estudio al no poder tener la oportunidad de estar en una aula de estudio. Desde muy pequeña se ha dedicado al cultivo de café, maíz, frijoles y a los 20 años decidió casarse con el que hoy en día tiene una familia también numerosa compuesta por 12 hijos. En su hogar solo viven 4 uno de 15 años es varón, otro de 13 años es varón, una hembra de 11 años, otra hembra de 5 años que actualmente en familia se dedican a cultivar café, maíz, frijoles. Diariamente trabajan fuertemente en sus cultivos para que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro y una tierra propia como patrimonio. Ella tiene mucha experiencia hace más de 20 años que se dedica a trabajar la tierra y agradece a DIOS por las tierra que tienen ya que son propias. Ella sueña con poder crecer  con sus bienes obtener nuevas parcelas para sus cultivos y poder aumentar la cantidad que tiene para obtener mejores ingresos para su familia.

Actualmente Doña Juana está solicitando un financiamiento con la que comprara 10 bolsas de urea, 10 bolsas de abono, 3 litros de gramoxone, 10 QQ de fórmula 18-46-0, 5 litros de foliar balforan y 10 QQ de abono 12-24-12 con los que dará una mejor y mayor asistencia a sus cultivos para tener una excelente cosecha al final de la temporada.
texts.en:
Juana was born into a very big family, which created a lot of restrictions for her and her siblings.  She was one of the ones who wasn't able to get an education.

Juana has worked growing coffee, corn, and beans since she was a little girl.  When she was 20 she decided to get married to the man with whom she currently has a large family of her own, made up of 12 children.  Only four of her children live with her: two boys, ages 15 and 13, and two girls, ages 11 and 5.

Currently they grow coffee, corn, and beans as a family.  They work very hard every day in their fields so their children will have a better future and their own property as assets.

Juana has a lot of experience.  She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and she's grateful to God for their land because it belongs to them.  She dreams of being able to grow and using her profits to get new plots of land for her crops so she can earn more income for her family.

Currently Juana's requesting a loan to buy 10 bags of urea, 10 bags of soil amendments, 3 liters of Gramoxone fertilizer, 10 quintals of formula 18-46-0, 5 liters of plant food, and 10 quintals of soil amendments 12-24-12.  This way she can better care for her crops and have an excellent harvest at the end of the season.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is a 33-year-old married man. He has two children who are 1 and 6 years old.

Abraham operates a poultry farm where he keeps chickens. He also owns a retail store where he sells sugar, soap, etc. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are local consumers. 

He describes his biggest business challenges to be lack of enough products and poultry feeds. He will use the loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy poultry feeds and add stock of sugar, soap, and other items to his retail store. His business goal is to be stable within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate and feed his family comfortably.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds and add stock of sugar, soap, and other items to his retail store.

loans.name: Princilla

texts.en:
Princilla is married with one child. She received some schooling until the end of senior high school.

Currently, Princilla sells groceries in Apowa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about 3 years now. Her husband is a community radio officer. Princilla’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses.

Princilla will use the loan to increase her existing groceries capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Princilla plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing groceries capacity.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma appreciates the previous loan she took from Kiva, which enabled her generate profits. In addition to her makuti (palm leaves) business, she prepares food such as flat bread, rice, and beans, and sells it to passersby and her neighbors.

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase food ingredients such as onions, tomatoes, and rice. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as onions, tomatoes, and rice.

loans.name: Saratt

texts.en:
Saratt lives in New Kru Town. She is 21 years old and single with two children aged 4 and 6, who are in school and live at home. For the past five years Saratt has been operating a small shop where she sells soap, tissues, copybooks, soft drinks and many other items. She says sometimes the buying is slow.

 Saratt says she started this business by selling around in the communities with the few goods she could afford. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods: soap,   tissues, copybooks, soft drinks and many items for her business, Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more goods: soap,   tissues, copybooks, soft drinks and many other items for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for laborers and rent land to farm

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for laborers and rent a field to cultivate.

loans.name: Jesebel

texts.en:
Jesebel is 56 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jesebel has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional equipment and gear for her fishing business.

Jesebel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment and gear for her fishing business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma appreciates the previous loan she had from Kiva. She is requesting a loan of KES 15,000 to purchase more makuti (palm leaves) for resale.

She thanks Yehu and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more makuti (palm leaves) for resale.

loans.name: Lofelia

texts.en:
Lofelia is 39 years old and married with two children. With both children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Lofelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Lofelia has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, eggs, bath soap, shampoo, detergent soap, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Lofelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is a 45-year-old lady. Her residence is in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She is the mother of five children; her husband owns a furniture shop in which he manufactures beds, sofas, tables and chairs. Her two sons are very expert in manufacturing furniture and help their father. Her husband has been making furniture for many years, and with the help of his two sons, his business is established very well. Their practice is to make furniture and then polish the furniture for finishing. Polish increases the shine, grace and value of the furniture.

The demand for manufacturing suddenly increased, and her husband has spent all the money to buy raw material instead of furniture polish. Now he does not have enough to buy his remaining raw material. Therefore, Gulshan requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy the remaining inventory.

Gulshan is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy polish for furniture finishing.

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   JIGUISSEME sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SEGOUBOUGOUDA, un des villages de FAKOLA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le mil  avec BA OUMOU 2ème debout à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  2hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à  FAKOLA   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Jiguisseme group are all married women, with an average age of 35. They have on average four children each, and live in polygamous families in Segoubougouda, a village located in Fakola, Mali’s third-largest administrative region. They work with the Soro Yiriwaso institution so they can carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season, and are on their third loan. All their prior loans have been successfully repaid.

The members of the group work growing millet, and one of its members is Ba Oumou, who is pictured standing second from the right in the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay labor expenses to farm her two hectares of land. After harvest her produce is sold in the village and elsewhere in Fakola, and her customers are both male and female.

Ba Oumou hopes to make an average profit of 145,500 francs CFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan, as well as to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay labor expenses for the agricultural season.

loans.name: Jahja

texts.en:
Jahja is a 31-year-old young man and father of three children between the ages of two and seven years old. He is married to a wonderful wife who is a housewife, staying home to care for their house and children. Since Jahja is very hard worker who works a lot to keep his family, he has tried all possible ways to survive and provide himself with a stable income. 

Currently, he not only works in a police station, but also he works on his land, planting corn and grains. He also owns a cow. By owning the cow and cultivating his land he is able to reduce costs for food products, and provide his family with healthy food. However, Jahja has had to sell his cow recently as he was in need of the money from the sale. 

Now for the first time he is requesting a loan so that he can once again purchase a cow to use for his family’s needs. By continuing to use his land and a  cow, he would be able to provide additional savings to send his children to school and also provide for the family’s basic needs. He thanks all lenders for supporting him!

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Nilda requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more goods like canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, and cream to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 12 years now.

Nilda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods like canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, and cream to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 29 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ana Marie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. she requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ana Marie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Revendeuse de céréales au marché, Ayélé âgée de 29ans n'a pas d'enfants en charge. Elle a  démarré son activité depuis un moment et s'approvisionne à Lomé. Souvent face aux problèmes de mévente, elle ne baisse pas les bras et sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Le profit l'aidera à constituer d'autres stock de marchandises et se marier plus tard.
texts.en: Ayélé is 29 years of age, and works reselling cereals in the market. She has no children under her care. She started her business recently, and gets her supplies in Lomé. Even though she often faces slumps in sales, she doesn’t give up and has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy more merchandise. The profits she earns will allow Ayélé to buy even more stock and, in the future, to get married.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Fatos

texts.en:
Fatos is a 28-year-old single male. He lives outside of the city with his brother and father, and his mother had remarried after his parents’ divorce. He is a very hardworking man who works a lot to earn a living.  Currently he works in a bakery, and this is the main source of his income. Unfortunately, Fatos has experienced a terrible situation recently, as thieves had broken into his home and caused much damage to their floor. 

Fatos is now requesting a loan so that he will be able to repair/renovate the damage done by these thieves, which he would not be able to do without the assistance of a loan. His goal is to find a better paying job and eventually get married and start his own family, saving all money possible for that future. He thanks all of the lenders for their support!

loans.use: to renovate his house after it was damaged by thieves.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie lives and works in St. Paul. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port. It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Jessie is 50 years old, and is married with three children between 10 and 30 years old. Only one of her children lives at home and is in school. 

Jessie runs a shop selling charcoal, rice, and oil. She describes herself as serious businesswoman. She started her business 6 years ago, using money given to her husband. Typically, she works 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. from Monday to Saturday at her business, and transports her goods to her business by bus.  She says that her greatest challenge is small capital.  She is proud of her business because it supports her home.

Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to purchase more charcoal, rice, and oil for her business. In the future, she plans to build her house. She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, rice, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona lives in Armavir with her mother and father. Nona’s mother is a teacher with many years of experience teaching at a local school. Her father works at a local company as a constructor. 

Nona herself studies at Yerevan State Medical University after Mkhitar Heratsi, and now is in her first course of study.

Nona’s parents work hard to sustain their daughter's living in Yerevan (as the university is located in Yerevan), so it very difficult for them to save money for her tuition. Thus, by applying for this loan, Nona asks a help for paying her tuition fee for the first semester.

She hopes for lenders' support and dreams of being able to complete her education and have a doctor's degree.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition for the first semester.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr:
Adzo est femme âgée de 48ans. Elle a pour conjoint un blanchisseur et mère de 04 enfants. Seul le dernier de 18ans est scolarisé. Depuis 2005, elle revend de la nourriture plus précisément de la pâte fermentée appelée
"Kom". Cette nourriture est préparée à base du maïs qui se mange avec de la sauce tomate et du poisson. Pour augmenter son stock de matières premières(maïs), elle fait sa toute première demande à WAGES. Elle espère épargner son profit et contribuer aux besoins de la famille. Elle est âgée de 48ans.
texts.en:
Adzo is a 48-year-old woman. She is married to a laundryman and is mother to four children. Only her youngest child, who is 18 years of age, is at school. Since 2005 Adzo has worked reselling food – namely a fermented paste called Kom. This food is prepared using corn, and is eaten with tomato sauce and fish. 

To increase her stocks of raw materials (corn), Adzo has requested her first loan from WAGES. She hopes to save her profits and help provide for her family. Adzo is 48 years of age.

loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер энергичный и чистосердечный молодой человек. Ему 25 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Его жена портниха. Алишер живет вместе с женой, ребенком и родителями. Его родители пенсионеры. Алишер более 5 лет занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Он работает с раннего утра до позднего вечера, так как является основным кормильцем семьи. Его ребенок в этом году идет в школу, и он должен оплатить за учебу сына в школе и купить школьные принадлежности и одежду. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки школьных принадлежностей, школьную форму, и оплатить за учебный договор. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Alisher is an energetic and a sincere young man.  He is 25 years old.  He is married and is raising a child.  His wife is a seamstress. Alisher lives together with his wife, child and his parents. His parents are retired.  For more than 5 years, Alisher has been working as a taxi driver.  Since he is the sole breadwinner in the family, he has to work from early in the morning until late at night.  

This year, his child is starting school and Alisher has to pay for his education and to buy school uniforms and supplies.  He is asking for a loan of 6000 somoni to purchase school supplies, uniforms and to pay for the school tuition.  He is waiting for your kindness and is hoping for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy school uniforms, supplies and to pay for the school tuition for his child.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Doña Dora de 57 años es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Dora solicita un crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras por mayor como: pipianes, güisquiles, papas, cebollas, tomates, etc. y con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dora is 57 years old and she is a very hardworking and kind person. She lives in her own house with her two children. For five years she has made a living selling fruits and vegetables in the market. She is able to cover some of her household expenses with the earnings she makes in her business. 

Dora is requesting a loan to purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale such as "pipianes" and "güisquiles" [types of gourds], as well as potatoes, onions, tomatoes, etc. With this she hopes to be able to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy "pipianes", "güisquiles", potatoes, onion, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Agrefina

texts.en:
Agrefina works hard to support her family. Agrefina is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from raising livestock and food vending.

Agrefina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store, like sugar, snack foods, milk, canned goods, noodles and other groceries.

In the future, Agrefina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store, like sugar, snack foods, milk, canned goods, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 31 years old. She lives with her mother in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. Her mother works as a housekeeper and gets a small monthly income. Nino works at a local kindergarten. 

As their income is not enough for the family to cover everyday costs, Nino decided to start her own business and seek for credit among local financial institutions, but her attempts was unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. The startup program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1,000 GEL. With the credit received, she will start trading with clothing. She plans to go to Turkey and purchase clothing at wholesale prices and then resell at higher prices. This will increase the income of her family. The new business initiative will give her a chance to have financial stability and monthly income.

loans.use: to begin trading with clothing.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a 29-year-old married woman.
 
For the past five years, she has been doing embroidery work using a machine at home to support her family. In fact, her husband is also doing the same work at home, but earns insufficient income to support his family. So, Noreen helps her husband in his tasks related to the embroidery, and she sells knitted embroidery in her town. She has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She has become expert in embroidery work and wants another embroidery machine for herself.

Therefore, she requested a loan to buy an embroidery machine so that she could sew more embroidery dresses to sell and could grow their income. 

Noreen is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide for her family. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of revenue to provide a quality education for her children. Noreen says thank to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru:
Малохат 42-летняя замужняя женщина из города Вахдат. Она домохозяйка. У нее четверо детей. 
Всегда приятно, если человек занимается тем делом что приносит удовольствие. Если превратить любимое дело или просто хобби в доходный бизнес, то в двойне приятно. Вот и Малохат собирается начать собственный швейный бизнес у себя на дому. Она умеет шить и кроить женские национальные платья. Но чтобы начать свое дело ей необходимо приобрести швейную машинку. Поэтому она решилась обратиться за кредитом. На сумму кредита она хочет купить новую автоматизированную швейную машину и ткани. По словам Малохат в день она будет шить одно простое платье и одно платье с вышивкой, и одновременно вести хозяйство. Она хочет начать зарабатывать и быть независимой.
texts.en:
Malohat is 42 years old, married, and lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is a homemaker.  She has four children.  It is always nice when a person is doing what they enjoy.  It is doubly so if one is able to convert their favorite activity or a hobby into a profitable business.  With this in mind, Malohat wishes to start her own sewing business from home.  She knows how to sew and tailor traditional dresses for women.  In order to start this business, she needs to obtain a sewing machine.  This is why she decided to ask for a loan.  

She wants to use this loan to buy a new automated sewing machine and some fabric.  Malohat expects, in a day, to sew one simple dress and one dress with embroidery.  At the same time, she will also take care of the household.  She wishes to start making money and to become independent.

loans.use: To purchase a new automated sewing machine and some fabric to start her own sewing business.

loans.name: Gantuya

texts.en: Ms.Gantuya is a bachelor degree student who studies at the public university of Mongolia. She desperately needed this loan, because if she did not get this loan, she will not be able to study this year. Graduating from university and supporting her family is her short term goal. She is very mature and responsible. She lives with her parents, sister and brother. This loan is for her tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Regina's Group

texts.en:
Regina, who is in her early 40s, is married with two children, both girls, who are in school. Regina has been smoking and selling fish for four years. She works from 4am to 6pm every working day and is able to make a very good return.

This is her sixth loan request of GHS 700 from ID-Ghana which she will use to buy a big carton of fish which she will smoke and sell to customers. All of her previous loans were repaid back successfully. Regina used her business profit to cover school fees, household expenses and bought a plot of land. She dreams that one day will be able to build her own house. 

She is collecting this loan with four others. Elizabeth sells plates, and Patience, Akweley and Abigail all sell fish. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a big carton of fish which she will smoke and sell to customers.

loans.name: Abdullojon

texts.ru: Абдуллоджон 42 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Он более 15 лет занимается скотоводством. Он имеет большой опыт и развевает свой бизнес год за годом. Он продает скот на местном рынке. Абдуллоджон откармливает скот у себя дома несколько месяцев. Его дочь помогает ему по откармливанию скота. Он хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом получить больше дохода. Дети год за годом растут и требуют больше благ. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Abdullojon is 42 years old.  He is married and is raising 5 children.  For more than 15 years, he has been raising livestock.  He has great experience and has been expanding his business each passing year.  He sells his cattle at the local market.  Abdullojon raises and fattens livestock at his house over a number of months.  His daughter helps him with raising of cattle.  He wishes to increase his working capital, to ultimately increase his profits.  Children are growing older with each year and require more necessities.  He is asking for a loan of 5000 somoni to purchase cattle.  He is waiting for your kindness and is hoping for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy cattle in order to grow his business.

loans.name: Heremakono I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   HEREMAKONO I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  31 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOTLA, un des villages de FAKOLA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  KOROTOUMOU 1ère debout à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  2hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the HEREMAKONO I group are married women who are, on average, 31 years old with three children each. They all live in polygamous families in Kotla, one of the villages of the Fakola commune (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their second loan with the institution, and their previous loan was duly repaid.

Korotoumou, a member of the group, grows groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the standing row, first from the left.

She plans to use her loan to buy some farm inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to maintain two hectares (4.9 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her crop in her village, at the market, to a customer base consisting of men and women.

She is expecting to make an average profit of 145,500 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the household's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to pay for the cost of plowing during the farming season.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret operates a groceries selling business in Apowa (near Cape Coast). Margaret is a single mother with two children. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Margaret uses her income to provide for the entire family. Margaret will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of groceries, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. 

As a junior high school graduate, Margaret understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of groceries.

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en:
Agartha is single and has three children. After successfully graduating primary school, Agartha is now an established businesswoman. She sells groceries in Apowa (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about three years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Agartha uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Agartha will use the loan to purchase more groceries, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agartha plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of groceries

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en:
Korpo lives and works in St. Paul.  St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port. It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing.
 
Korpo is 48 years old, and married with a child. Her child is attending college and lives at home. For the past ten years, Korpo has been operating a small table market where she sells bitter ball, peppers, onions, vita, and many other items. She started this business by selling dried fish around in her community with the little goods she could afford, and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase bitter ball, peppers, onions, vita and many other items for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase bitter ball, peppers, onions, vita and many other items for her business.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli is a 25-year-old married man. He lives in Zugdidi district with his wife, mother-in-law and an infant son. Currently, the family has no source of income. 

Irakli decided to start his own business and seek credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts was unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program, to get a loan of $1,500. With the credit received, he will open a bakery and bake Georgian bread to sell. He has already built a bakery and needs money for purchasing raw materials. 

Irakli hopes that the business will be profitable, as the place is very crowded and there are no other bakeries nearby. The new business initiative will give him a chance to have financial stability and a monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and open a bakery.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 41-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be ambitious and optimistic. 

Judith operates a retail store where she sells sugar, soap and other consumer products. She has been involved in this business for nine years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices from suppliers. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to add stock of salt, sugar and other consumer products to her store. Her business goal is to meet her family's needs within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previously loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: add stock of salt, sugar and other consumer products to her store.

loans.name: Heremakono Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   HEREMAKONO II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 4enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOTLA, un des villages de FAKOLA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec FANTA 1ère  assise à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à  FAKOLA   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 155.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the HEREMAKONO II group are married women who are, on average, 39 years old with four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Kotla, one of the villages of the Fakola commune (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their second loan with the institution, and their previous loan was duly repaid.

Fanta, a member of the group, grows groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the front row, first from the right.

She plans to use her loan to buy some farm inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to maintain two hectares (4.9 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her crop in her village and in Fakola, to a customer base consisting of men and women.

She is expecting to make an average profit of 155,500 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the household's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing during the farming season.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is 37; she has four children and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a scrap dealer; he purchases scrap iron, plastic accessories, aluminum, and copper from retailers or hawkers and sells them to a recycling factory. He has been doing same business for many years, and earning reasonable profit for his family. 

He loves his children a lot, and wants to provide them a better way of living. He wants to earn maximum income to ensure and secure a better future for his children. 

Recently, he met with a new retailer who has scrap in large quantities which is beyond from his purchasing capacity. Therefore, Irshad requested a loan so she could help her husband, and he would be able to buy that scrap material.

Irshad hopes that this loan will enhance the earning capacity of her husband; in this way she would be able to increase their savings.

Irshad seems very glad after taking this loan, and says thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: To buy scrap iron, plastic, aluminum and copper to sell.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en:
Felecia lives in New Kru town. She is 48 years old and single, with three children between the ages of 10 and 29. Only two are in school and live at home. 

For the past three years, she has been selling onions, pepper, Vita (juice drink) and other items. She started this business by selling rice around in the communities with the little goods she could afford, and learned this way of selling from her mother.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more onions, pepper, Vita and many items for her business. Her plans are to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, pepper, Vita, and many items for her business.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 23-year-old single young man from Jabalia. He lives with his family in a small house. Yousef's father is a worker. He is the only source of income to the family. 

Yousef is a university student in his last year. He studies agriculture and the environment. Yousef likes this specialization because he would like to work in agriculture after finishing his studies. 

Yousef took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan has helped him buy a new laptop for his studies.  With his new laptop, Yousef will be able to do his homework and write his reports more easily. 

Yousef appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university studies

loans.name: Madinakhon

texts.ru: Мадинахон с детства всегда мечтала получить высшее образование. Ей 21 года. Она разведена и не имеет детей. Мадинахон живет с родителями. Она является студенткой 3 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Политики и Бизнеса. Она учится по специальности Финансы и кредит в заочном отделении. Она одновременно работает в государственной организации. Мадинахон учится в университете отлично. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Madinakhon since her childhood has always dreamed of obtaining a higher education. She is 21 years old. She is divorced and doesn't have children. Madinakhon lives with her parents. She is in her third year at Tajikistan State University of Politics and Business. She is studying to obtain a degree from the finance and credit correspondence department. At the same time she works for the government. Madinakhon is a good university student. She needs to pay for training, but has no money. She is asking for the loan to pay for the training contract. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for her education.

loans.name: Heremakono Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   HEREMAKONO III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  33 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOTLA, un des villages de FAKOLA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec FATOUMATA 1ère debout à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village à  FAKOLA   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the HEREMAKONO III group are married women who are, on average, 33 years old with four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Kotla, one of the villages of the Fakola commune (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their second loan with the institution, and their previous loan was duly repaid.

Fatoumata, a member of the group, grows groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the standing row, first from the left.

She plans to use her loan to buy some farm inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to maintain two hectares (4.9 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her crop in her village and in Fakola, to a customer base consisting of men and women.

She is expecting to make an average profit of 150,500 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the household's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to pay for the cost of plowing during the farming season.

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   DJANTOYERELA  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  33 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à ZEGUERE, un des villages de FAKOLA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec WARABA 1ère debout à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à  FAKOLA   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the DJANTOYERELA group are married women who are, on average, 33 years old with four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Zeguere, one of the villages of the Fakola commune (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their sixth loan with the institution, and their previous loans have been duly repaid.

Waraba, a member of the group, grows groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the standing row, first from the right.

She plans to use her loan to buy some farm inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to maintain one hectare (2.47 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her crop in her village and in Fakola to a customer base consisting of men and women.

She is expecting to make an average profit of 85,500 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the household's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing during the farming season.

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is 32 years old and married. He is from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and kids in a small house in the city. Nader is a construction worker. He gets a good income but his job is seasonal, so his income fluctuates depending on market demand.

Nader took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water heater and solar cells for heating water. This will decrease the use of electricity and use clean power like the sun. This will improve the family's living conditions.

Nader appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water heater and solar cells for heating water

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 33-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father of one son and two daughters. Mohammad is a worker in the local company. He earns a low income which is not enough to cover all the family needs. Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family home. By applying for this loan, Mohammad can provide pure water for his kids and protect them from pollution and disease. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family home

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en: Riffat is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of 4 children. She has been running a business selling clothing for many years. She buys a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her neighborhood. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. Riffat applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. As a result, she will be able to earn more income through her increased sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rihana

texts.en: Rihana is 51-year-old married woman. She is very talented and has good experience in stitching clothes. She has received a lot of appreciation from her community. She decided to start her own business four years ago to support her family. Now that she has attained a good number of customers, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers due to lack of availability of funds. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 15,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in different colors. It will help her to complete her orders without delay. She dreams of expanding her business by opening a stitching center where girls in her community can come learn stitching.

loans.use: to buy a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in different colors.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 41-year-old married woman and mother of three children. She has been running her business of hand embroidery for many years with the support of her husband. She is happily doing it for the sake of her family. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today she is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful designs. Now she has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more material such as spools of thread with packs of beads and glittering material in different colors. She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that she has taken up. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more material such as spools of thread with packs of beads and glittering material in different colors.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is a 23-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for the past four years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She has become famous in her town for providing good quality footballs. She earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. She is contributing much to the family income, as her husband’s income is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of the family members alone. To improvement her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of Rs. 25,000. The amount will be used to purchase threads, rubber bladders and leather covers in large quantities to cater to more customers without delay. She is hopeful to get an increase in her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use the part of profits on her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase threads, rubber bladders and leather covers in large quantities to manufacture footballs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace lives in New Kru town. She is 24 years old and she lives with her fiancée, who is a contractor. They have a child who is two years old. For the past four years, she has been selling fish in the local market. She started this business with loan from her friend and learned this way of selling from her friends. She sells for nine hours per day from Monday to Saturday. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She plans is to send her child to school and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
