Samina is a 25-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of clothing sale for the last four years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. 

Samina requested a loan of PKR 15,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season by taking in account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales.

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and grow her business. She dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes of the summer season.

loans.name: Lucenia Antonia

texts.es:
Doña Lucenia curso hasta el sexto grado y está acompañada siendo su pareja al igual que ella agricultor con quien tiene 5 hijos los cuales el mayor que tiene 18 años ya se graduó de técnico automotriz actualmente les apoya con las actividades de su negocio y desempeña como mecánico y les ayuda con los gastos de su hogar, la segunda tiene 16 años y está cursando el tercer año de ciclo común en una comunidad cercana, el tercero tiene 14 años y está cursando el 2 año de ciclo común, el cuarto tiene 12 años y está finalizando su periodo escolar en la escuela de la comunidad y el ultimo tiene 7 años y está en primer año todos viven con ellos. Ella aprendió esta actividad desde muy pequeña ya que sus padres se han dedicado a esta actividad por generaciones y ahora lo hace junto a su conyugue. Su producto al final de cada cosecha es vendido a intermediarios que son los que llegan hasta la comunidad. Sus cultivos están ubicados aproximadamente a 2 kilómetros de su casa de habitación aunque una pequeña fracción de su cultivo está ubicada en la misma comunidad, en esta actividad se involucran todos los miembros de su hogar así evitan el costo de contratar mucho personal.

Actual mente ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara 4 QQ de urea, 4 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12 y 4 QQ de fórmula 18-46-0 con lo que dará mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café. 

Una de sus metas a futuro es construir una granja avícola para así poder lograr que las aldeas cercanas le compren su producto ya que ella piensa que esto lo lograra ofreciendo productos de calidad y buenos precios y así esos ingresos se queden dentro de la comunidad, generar más empleo y mejorar sus ingresos para ofrecerles un mejor patrimonio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucenia is married and has a sixth grade education.  Her husband is a farmer like her.  They have five children, with the oldest being 18.  He is a graduate of the automotive technical collage and helps them with their business.  He also works as a mechanic and helps them with their household expenses.  The next oldest is 16 years old and finishing the third year of high school in a nearby community.  The third is 14 years old and is finishing the second year of high school.  The next is 12 years old and finishing elementary school.  The youngest is 7 and in first grade.  He lives with them.

She learned this when she was very young, since her family has been doing this for generations and now she does this with her husband.  She sells her harvests to intermediaries who visit her community.  Her crops are located about two km from her home, although a small portion of them are in the same community.  The whole family pitches in, so they are able to avoid the cost of hiring a lot of people.

She is asking for a loan to buy 4QQ of urea, 4 QQ of formula 12-24-12, and 18-46-0 for her coffee crops.

One of her goals is to build an avian farm so that the people from the nearby surrounding areas will buy from her.  She believes that she will accomplish this by offering good quality products at good prices, so that the income stays within the community, creating more jobs, and improving her income so she can be a better parent.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma appreciates the previous Kiva loan she had that improved her living standards.

She is requesting a loan of KES 15,000 to purchase wheat flour, salt, cooking oil, and maize flour. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, salt, cooking oil, and maize flour.

loans.name: Oroskul

texts.ru: Ороскул 55 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Ороскул - высшее образование, работала в местной школе преподавателем русского языка. Имеет очень большой авторитет среди сельчан. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Ороскул стала заниматься животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Ороскул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы и 15 голов овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Ороскул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Ороскул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Oroskul is 55 years old, she is married and is raising 2 children with her spouse.  Oroskul has a college education and worked at a local school as a teacher of Russian.  She has a lot of authority among the villagers.  As a main source of income for her family Oroskul started raising livestock, starting 15 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 20,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work Oroskul now has 4 milk cows and 15 sheep.  Her monthly income is 5,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her holdings Oroskul turned to Microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of cows in order to increase her livestock count.  Oroskul plans to invest her profits from the loan into further increasing her livestock count and plans to save up resources for her children's further education.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es divorciada y tiene do hijos los cuales ya son independientes, vive en la ciudad de La Paz.
Ha modificado su actividad laboral, trabaja vendiendo ropa y víveres de forma ambulante ofreciendo a los trufis o en las paradas de buses y con lo poco que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para incrementar su mercadería de ropa ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Celia es tener una tienda propia para vender sus productos ya que es muy sacrificado el trabajo que realiza durante todo el día cargando quintales de azúcar y arroz, además de vender la ropa
texts.en:
Celia is divorced and has three adult children.  She lives in La Paz and works, selling clothing and food on foot at taxi stands and bus stops. She covers the cost of her food and basic expenses with the money she earns.

She needs this loan so she can increase her inventory of clothing because she wants to improve her income and quality of life.

Celia's dream is to have a store where she can sell her products because the work she does is very difficult, carrying quintals of sugar and rice, besides selling clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Alma Nidia

texts.es:
Alma es  casada, orginaria de Nagarote, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del pais. ella se caractreriza por ser una persona, trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superacion personal, en sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta con su familia. les prepara platos tipicos como " Nacatamal" lamentablemente por falta de recursos economico no pudo cursar una carrera, y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad economica la venta materiales de oficina y colegio una pequena libreria con productos como cuadernos, lapiz, corrector, crallones, minas, cartulinas, marcadores, cuadernos, libretas, fastener, grapas, papellillos. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion. actividad que la desempena con mucho gusto, el objetivo del credito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Alma agradece la ayuda que los inversionista kiva le brinan a personas de escasos recursos y paises pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Alma is married and originally from Nagarote, a place that is located in the western part of the country.  She is known for being a hardworking and responsible person who wants to excel on a personal level.  In her free time, she enjoys being with her family and preparing traditional dishes, such as Nicaraguan tamales.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, Alma was not able to study for a degree.  She was obligated to begin working at a young age so that she could help with the household expenses.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to succeed, Alma now has a business of selling office and school supplies from a small bookstore.  She offers products such as notebooks, pencils, correction fluid, crayons, pencil lead, poster board, markers, notepads, fasteners, staples, and primers.  Her business is located in her home and manages it with great enthusiasm.  

Alma’s loan will be used as operating capital for restocking her business.  In the not-so-distant future, she would like to generate more income.  She appreciates the assistance that the Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and come from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they are able to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to restock her bookstore with various merchandise.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. she was an old member of BRAC and is now taking a new loan after a year. A year ago, she took a loan and purchased an auto rickshaw for her husband with the contribution of her savings. Due to continuous work, the rickshaw engine became out of order and unable to start. Her husband checked out his rickshaw to the mechanic and he let him know the huge expense over engine. This expense is out of his reach.

Therefore, Rubina again contacted Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, and describe her financial problem. The field staff checked out her old good behavior, and she was given approval for the new loan.

She seems very after over this honorable act and says thanks to Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her husband's Rickshaw engine.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 21-year-old married woman in the business of selling goats for the last four years. At the present, she has three goats. Her business is good enough to lead her a decent life. 

She purchases small goats, and after nurturing them, she sells them in her community. She has improved her business to meet the day to day expenses of life. It’s her 4th year with Kashf Foundation. 

She is happily running her business with the support of it. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two more goats. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Nadra

texts.en:
Nadra is a 32-year-old married woman who has been running a beauty parlor for many years. Her husband is a government employee whose income is insufficient to meet the household expenses alone. She is happily doing it for the sake of her family. 

She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Through her best providing services, she has become very famous in her territory. 

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetic products for her parlor. For this reason, she applied for her eighth loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase packs of makeup kits, lipsticks and creams. It will help her cater to more customers and generate more income. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase packs of makeup kits, lipsticks, and creams to meet the increasing demands of her customers.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 26 years old and a hardworking housewife. She has no children. 

Her husband owns a vegetable shop, which is the only source of income for the family. He purchases a variety of fresh and seasonal vegetables from the field and sells them in the main market. 

At present, he needs to purchase more vegetables for his shop to increase his business.   For that, his wife Razia has requested for a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to buy vegetables. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and increase his net income. 

With the help of those new profits, Razia hopes to get some savings to cope with sudden needs and emergencies.
 
Razia prays for the success of her husband’s business. She is feeling relaxed and happy after taking out the loan.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for her husband to sell.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in the photo.

Muna is a 44-year-old divorced woman from Rafah city. She lives with her brother in a humble house. Mona works on her own land where she can cultivate some seasonal crops and sell them in the local market. She uses greenhouses to insure that the quality is very good and also uses a clean energy from the sun. 

Muna took out a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more iron and plastic covers to build more greenhouses. This will increase her productivity and also her income. 

Muna dreams of taking out a bigger loan in the future and expanding her farm.

loans.use: to buy more iron and plastic covers to build more greenhouses.

loans.name: Lia

texts.es:
Lia es soltera, no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres en la ciudad de La Paz 
Trabaja como auxiliar contable en una istitucion donde percibe un sueldo pequeño con el cual se mantiene y cubre sus estudios, el crédito que solicita es para pagar los tramites de reularizacion de la casa de sus padres, y darles a ellos tranquilidad y puedan vivir mejor.
El sueño de Lia es salir profesional y poder tener ella su vivienda propia.
texts.en: Lia is single and has no children and lives with her parents in La Paz.  She works as an accountant's helper in an institution where she earns a small salary with which she supports herself and pays for her studies.  She is asking for this loan to pay for her parents' housing expenses so she can provide them with tranquility so that they can live better.  Lia's dream is to come out ahead professionally and be able to have a home of her own.

loans.use: pay for housing expenses.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 52 years old and a beautician. She is married to Grado, a policeman. Their marriage is blessed with four children. Margaret has been running her salon for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 6000 which she uses to cater to her family's needs. 

Margaret is applying for her first loan term with KADET.  She will use the loan to purchase weaves, a blow-dry machine and cosmetics. 

With the expected profit from her business she will improve the living standards of her family. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a profit-making salon.

loans.use: To purchase weaves, a blow-dry machine and cosmetics.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a 47-year-old married woman and a loving mother of four children. She enjoys her business of embroidery with her husband. She has an in depth knowledge of making beautiful patterns. She earns enough for a hand to mouth existence. With the support of Kashf foundation she has built a successful business. Currently she requested a loan of 35000 PKR to purchase raw material such as thread, pearls, beads and sequins in different colors. While speaking to a loan officer at Kashf she said that her children have never slept without having a meal ever since she started working on her own. She wishes to utilize part of the revenue for the betterment of her family. She is now in her third loan cycle. She is hopeful that her work would help them fight against poverty.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as thread, pearls, beads and sequins in different colors.

loans.name: Mujeres De Poder (Women Of Power) Group

texts.en:
The eight women in the group Mujeres de Poder (Women of Power) approached a Namaste Business Advisor and asked if they could become part of Namaste’s business training program, as they had friends and neighbors (in Ciudad Vieja, Sacatepéquez, Guatemala) who were already in the program.  The women they knew had improved their businesses and increased their sales and profits, and the women in this group wanted to do the same with their businesses.  Most of the women in this group sell food such as tortillas, chicken, bread and meals.  One woman sells aprons and another catalog products.

Aura Marina, 40, third from the left in the group photo, sells mid-day meals in an area near Ciudad Vieja’s central market.  She has a sixth grade education and inherited this business from her mother when she was 10 years old.  She is a single mother of two grown children, and also has one child still in school.  She works six hours a day, every day of the week.  Her dream is to have enough savings to buy a small lot of her own so she can stop paying rent.  

With her loan she plans to buy a food processor to help her prepare food more efficiently, and a table, chair and tarp to improve her selling space.  With these purchases, and the business plan she has developed with her Namaste Business Advisor, she hopes to increase her monthly profit from Q1,982 (US $254) to Q3,430 (US $439).

loans.use: to buy a table, chair and tarp to improve her selling space.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo, esta casado tiene 5 hijos vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz.
Leonardo, trabaja como chofer de Minibus en transporte publico, con esta actividad el mantiene a su familia y puede cubrir sus mas mínimas necesidades, el crédito que solicita es para comprar otra movilidad y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos ya que sus hijos ya son jovenes.

El sueño de Leonardo es poder hacer construir su casita ya que actualmente vive en dos habitaciones
texts.en:
Leonardo is married with five children and lives with his parents in the zone Las Lomas in the city of La Paz.
Leonardo works as a public transportation driver at Minibus with this activity he keeps his family and can meet their most basic needs.

The loan requested is to buy another vehicle and thereby improve his income because his children are getting older.

Leonardo's dream is to be able to build his home as he currently lives in two rooms.

loans.use: purchase a vehicle for use in the transportation business

loans.name: Jescah

texts.en:
Jescah is a forty-nine-year-old woman who is married to Julius. She lives and takes care of her two grandchildren in the outskirts of Kangemi where she also operates a food stall in Ngong road. Jescah has been in this business for ten years now and earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be Jescah's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy a potato peeler, juicer, and use some money to renovate the floor of her stall. In the future she wants to open another food stall.

loans.use: To purchase a potato peeler, juicer, etc.

loans.name: Munawer

texts.en: Munawer is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. For about 7 years she has been working in hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to develop a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy reels of different colored thread along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones for decoration. In this way, she will be able to complete the orders of her customers on time. She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers. She dreams of her children's bright future and hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy reels of different colored thread along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones.

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en: Manzooran is a 43-year-old married lady and has run a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store.  She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR that she will use to buy a stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet her increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Roseann

texts.en:
Roseann is a 45-year-old chicken and vegetable seller. She is married to David, a businessman. They are blessed with five children. Roseann has been selling chicken and vegetables for the past ten years with a monthly income of 15,000 KES that she uses to support her family. 

Roseann is applying for her third loan from KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Roseann will use the loan to buy poultry feed and green groceries for resale. She will pay school fees for her children with the expected profit from the business. Roseann hopes and dreams to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed and green groceries for resale.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Ángel vive en una casa alquilada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja en una entidad publica por mas de diez horas y con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de alquileres y servicios básicos. 
Necesita credito para un curso de actualizacion en Administracion Pública y con los ingresos que tiene no puede cubrir los gastos para sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ángel lives in a rented house in the city of La Paz. He currently works for a public institution for more than 10 hours a day and he needs to cover the cost of food, education and rent as well as basic services with his income.

He is seeking this loan to pay for a refresher course in Public Administration, as he is unable to cover the costs for these studies with what he earns.

loans.use: to pay for a refresher course.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío, es madre soltera, tiene una hija que esta en etapa escolar ,vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo dos habitaciones,la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como Medico Cirujano en un hospital privado por mas de cinco horas al día y a veces toda la noche,ya que debe cubrir turnos nocturnos.
El crédito lo requiere para el pago de actualización y post grado en su carrera para mejorar sus ingresos, ya que con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir los pagos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos en su casa,es por eso que no le alcanza para pagar su post grado.
El sueño de Rocío es terminar su carrera y mejorar sus ingresos para poder independizarse y darle mejor calidad de vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Rocío is a single mother who has a daughter who is at school. She lives in her parents' home, taking up only two rooms. The house is found in the Miraflores area of the city of La Paz. Rocío currently works as a surgeon in a private clinic for more than five hours a day, and sometimes all night as she needs to cover night shifts. 

Rocío needs the loan to pay for a refresher postgraduate course to improve her income as with what she earns she needs to cover the cost of education, food and basic services in her house, hence why she doesn't have enough to pay for her postgraduate studies.

Rocío dreams of finishing her degree and increasing her income so that she can become independent and give her daughter a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for a refresher course.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to the exterior of his home.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been running a beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her providing her best services she has become very famous on her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetic products for the parlor.  But because of having low cash in hand she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan. She needs a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.
 
She is hopes to cater to more customers time after time. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future to support her family well.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 31-year-old married woman doing a business of selling milk for the past 20 years. She has two buffaloes and one cow in milk. Since that time she has become famous for providing good quality milk and has attained a regular list of customers. Her business is good enough to lead her a decent life. She has four daughters and one son, all are school going. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

It is her second year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business through its support. She has now requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves. In this way she would be to inflate her sales to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for the calves.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Micheal is a man of 63 years, married to Catherine and a father of four children. He is a bee farmer and has been in this business for nine years now. He gets a monthly income of 6,000 shillings.

This will be Michael's second loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the money to construct more bee hives. In future, he wants to be a successful business man and also increase his honey production.

loans.use: to buy timber, nails, iron sheets, etc.

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru: Махфирату 60 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Ее муж инженер. Она умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Махфират более 40 лет работает учительницей русского языка в средней школе. Махфират любит свою профессию и у нее много учеников, которые работают в различных сферах народного хозяйства. Она хочет, чтобы ее внуки получили высшее образование. Ее внук в этом году окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Горно -Металлургический Университет Таджикистана. Она хочет оплатить за учебный договор своего внука и с такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mahfirat is 60 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband is an engineer. She is a smart and hardworking woman. Mahfirat has been working as a teacher of the Russian language in the secondary school for over 40 years. Mahfirat loves her profession and has many students who work in different fields of national economy. She wants for her grandchildren to receive higher education. Her grandson has graduated from school this year and has enrolled in the University of Mining and Metallurgy of Tajikistan. She wants to pay for the tuition of her grandson and has come for a loan with this purpose. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for education of her grandchild.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is 47 years old married woman; she has been running a business of animals’ sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, brings them up then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes good amount of income to contribute in the family income. 

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing better standard of living to her family, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 49-year-old, married woman, who has had a business selling milk for the past 20 years. She has five buffaloes in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life.

She has two daughters and two sons; all attend school. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

It is her second year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business with their support. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes to see an increase in the production of milk, which ultimately helps her generate more cash.  

.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Satta

texts.en:
Satta lives in New Kru town, she is 48 years old, married and has five children aged between 10 and 33.  Only two of her children attend school and live at home.  

For the past 24 years Satta has been selling potatoes, peppers, bitter-balls and other items.  She sells for nine hours per day from Monday to Saturday.

Satta is requesting a loan to purchase more potatoes, peppers, bitter-balls and other items for her business.  Her plan is to expand her business and to see her children out of high school.

loans.use: to purchase more potatoes, peppers, bitter-balls and other items for her business.

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en: Rizwana is a 23-year-old hardworking lady who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past five years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue her business operations, she has requested for a loan of 15,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and lace to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with the packs of zippers and lace.

loans.name: Duncun

texts.en:
Duncun is a young man who is twenty-nine years old. He is married to Maurine and is the father of two children. He hawks second-hand shoes in Kinoo in the outskirts of Kangemi. He has been in this business for one year now and he gets a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

This will be Duncun's first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy shoes for reselling. In the future he wants to sell clothes as well as open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to resell.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila is a 40-year-old married lady. She has been involved in the business of selling cloth for a period of about 5 years. She buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then after making beautiful embroidery patterns sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is a 41-year-old married lady and the mother of two. She is very talented and excels in stitching. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she has requested for a loan of 30,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy packs of lace, zippers and buttons, and more spools of thread in different colours. In this way she will be able to stitch more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 3rd loan cycle, and has a good repayment history. She hopes to expand her business in the near future to meet her household expenses more efficiently.

loans.use: to buy packs of lace, zippers and buttons, and more spools of thread in different colours.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 30-year-old married woman. She has sewing to earn a living for the last three years. Her husband is a private employee who earns a low salary income and this compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. She is happily doing it for the sake of her family. She is trying hard to fulfil her family members' demand for food, health and clothing. For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of ribbons, elastic and buttons to complete the orders of her customers without fail. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads along with packs of ribbons, elastic and buttons.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 54-year-old man, who is married to Veronica and is the father of four children. He is involved in bee farming and sells honey. He also sells vegetables. He has been in this business for nine years now and gets a monthly income of 60,000 KES.

This will be Godfrey's second loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy materials like timber, iron sheets and net to make new houses for the bees. He wants to be a prosperous business man in the future.

loans.use: to purchase timber, iron sheets and net, to make bee houses.

loans.name: Abariki Group

texts.fr: La cliente Sinamenye est un membre du collectif  d’affaire  « Abariki», senior entrepreneur expérimentée et  mère de 6 enfants qui étudient. Son conjoint est un vendeur dans une compagnie privée. La cliente s’est déjà spécialisée dans la vente des unités cellulaires. Elle a choisi être opérateur d’un seul article, faute d’un capital rotatif insuffisant. Elle installe ses articles au point de vente dans son quartier. Elle commença ses affaires avec  le prêt de l’IMF Hekima, il y a environ 3 ans. Ce nouveau crédit va lui servir d’acheter 1000 unités et 50 SIM cards (cartes  de réseaux vodacom,  Tigo,  Orange,  Airtel, MTN). Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses  enfants. Le défaut de connexion réseau est un grand défi pour son activité. Elle accuse de lourdes pertes en cas de perturbation réseau. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Sinamenye is a member of the Abariki group. She is an experienced entrepreneur and a mother of six children, who all go to school. Her husband is a vender in a private company. 

Sinamenye specializes in the sale of mobile phones. She chose this one type of item, because she lacks sufficient cash flow. She displays her goods at a place in her area. She started this business with a loan from Hekima about three years ago. This new loan will be used to buy 1,000 mobile units and 50 SIM cards (from Vodacom, Tigo, Orange, Airtel, MTN). 

In particular, Sinamenye wishes to expand her business, and feed and school her children. 

Network connections and failures are a big challenge to her business. She suffers losses when there are disruptions in the networks. 

Finally, Sinamenye strongly thanks Hekima for their lending support to small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 1,000 units and 50 SIM cards (from Vodacom, Tigo, Oranges, Airtel, MTN)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina lives and works in St. Paul. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia passed the free-port. It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. Christina is 30 years old and married with five children between 3 months old to 12 years old. Only three of her children are in school and live at home. 

For the past 3 years she has been operating a small shop where she sells soap, tissue, oil, etc. She says sometimes buying goes slowly. Christina says she started this business by selling around in the communities with the few goods she could afford. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap, tissue, oil, etc. for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, tissue, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Drissa est né vers 1977 à Bougouni. Père de 4 enfants il vit dans une famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Il mène des activités de commercialisation de céréales depuis plus de 15 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de céréales, notamment du maïs et du sorgho. Il y’a 3 trois mois de cela qu’il a commencé d’associer aux céréales la vente d’huile d’arachide. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, il collabore avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son  10 eme prêt maintenant, les neuf prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter,  4 tonnes de maïs et 1 tonne de sorgho et 10 bidons de 20 litre d’huile.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako, Garalo et dans les villages  environs. Les céréales sont stockées dans son magasin pendant un certain temps. Il  les revend au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes venant de Sikasso et de Bamako et souvent Idrissa les transporte à Bamako au besoin. Mais l’huile est vendu est à tout moment dans son magasin situé au grand marché.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 160 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt, assuré ses dépenses en famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
Il compte devenir un grossiste à Bougouni.
texts.en:
Idrissa was born in 1977 in Bougouni. A father of four children, he lives in a traditional family in the Massablacoura neighborhood in the town of Bougouni (in the third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

Idrissa has been selling cereals for fifteen years. His experience has earned him a good reputation and he receives orders for cereals, especially corn and sorghum. Three months ago, he also started selling groundnut oil. 

In order to have the stock he needs to satisfy his customers, he is working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his tenth loan now, and his nine previous loans have all been repaid correctly. This new loan will allow him to buy four tons of corn, one ton of sorghum, and ten 20-liter drums of oil. He procures his goods in Bamako, Garalo, and in surrounding villages. 

The cereals are stored in his store until a certain time. He resells them for cash to men and women customers who come from Sikasso and from Bamako. Often, he will ship product to Bamako when needed. 

Mais, the oil is sold right away in his shop which is located in a large market. 

With this loan, he hopes to earn an average monthly income of 160,000 francs CFA. These earnings will allow him to pay the interest on his loan, cover his family expenses, and invest in his business. He hopes to become a wholesaler in Bougouni.

loans.use: to buy cereals and groundnut oil

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en: Mwanamkuu is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase soap, wheat flour, sweets, cooking oil, and tea leaves for resale.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her increase the size of her business and attract new customers. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, sweets, cooking oil, and tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
Hakob is from Arevadasht village of Armavir region where he lives with his wife and 4 infant children. Hakob has been involved in the agricultural business for 8 years and is already a skilled farmer. Currently he runs a farm which includes 15 chickens and 5 cows. Hakob also cultivates pepper and grass to feed the livestock. 

As the only breadwinner of the family, Hakob works really hard to be able to earn enough income and cover his family's costs. Now he is requesting a loan from SEF in order to purchase 2 calves and hire workers to gather the harvest. The loan is very important for Hakob to be able to gather his harvest and sell it in local markets. The loan will greatly assist him to continue his farming business and sustain his family's living.

loans.use: to pay for 2 calves and hire workers to gather the harvest.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 24 years old from Nakuru and he is not yet married. He has been in the quarrying business for the last 5 years. He has applied for his first loan of 20,000 KES from Kadet Ltd. His plan is to use it to hire more laborers to work in the quarry as well as to buy more tools like mallets and drills to increase productivity.

Alfred's monthly income right now is 30,000 KES and he is going to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to open another business. He hopes and dreams of buying a plot for quarry mining in the future.

loans.use: To hire more workers so as to boost his productivity in the quarry industry.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in hair dressing in Domenase (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 6 years. Ekua is married and has 5 children. Her husband works as a herbal doctor. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and their children’s school fees. Ekua wants to use her loan to buy hair products to expand her hair dressing business. In the long term, Ekua plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to buy hair products to expand her hair dressing business.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: After graduating middle school, Aba decided to set up her own second-hand clothing business in Domenase (near Cape Coast). With over 20 years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her by purchase more clothing to resell. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a mason) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their 4 children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to resell.

loans.name: Susana's Group

texts.en:
Dromo 2 is made up of nine members and led by Susana as the representative. The businesses that the members carry out are varied: the sale of jewelry, salt, provisions, egg, maize, vegetables and underwear.

The loan that they take out will benefit small entrepreneurs, one of whom is Susana. Susana says that she joined ID-Ghana due to an invitation from her friend, Comfort, who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling jewelry. She says that she launched this business on the recommendation of her sister-in-law, who worked in the same field before.

She needs a loan of 600 GHS to increase her capital by purchasing jewelry from the wholesale market and reselling it to her customers in Teshie township. She will get the jewelry from her sister-in-law, who is a wholesale supplier, and then will sell it in her sales space. This method of work allows her to generate income to keep up her home, as she is single with two children.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry from the wholesale market and resell it to her customers in Teshie township.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo esta separado, tiene dos hijos, tiene casa propia en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como chofer en transporte publico de un trufi, con esta actividad el se mantiene y puede ayudar a sus hijos, el crédito que solicita es para pagar los estudios de bachillerato de su hijo mayor.
El sueño de Gonzalo es poder darles una buena profesión a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is separated, has two children, and has his own house in the city of La Paz. He currently works in public transportation as a minibus driver. With this job, he supports himself and is able to help his sons. 

The loan he is requesting is to pay for secondary school studies for his older son. 

Gonzalo's dream is to be able to give his sons a good job.

loans.use: to pay school fees for one of his sons

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Please meet 50-year-old Mary from St. Paul in Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the free-port.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Mary completed 10 school grades and is married.  Her husband is a teacher. She has 3 children between the ages of 10 and 25.  Two are in school and they all live at home. Mary owns her own shop selling plastic bags, sugar, rice, etc.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more plastic bags, sugar, rice, etc. for her business.  

On average, she works 10 hours per day at her business.  She started her business with money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by taxi.  She cites her small income as her biggest challenge.  Her favorite part of her business is making a profit.  In the future, she would like to build a house.  She thanks you in advanced for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more plastic bags, sugar, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 34 years old, and from Nakuru. She is not married but she has one child aged 6 years old. She is in the tailoring business, and has been in operation for the past seven years. She has applied for her third loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD which will enable her to buy stock of clothing materials and sewing thread for her business, in bulk.

Flora's monthly income right now is 10,000 KES and she hopes to use the anticipated profit from her expanded business in buying a plot. Her hopes and dreams for the future are that she will own one of the most magnificent clothing companies and for her child to be well catered for.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials and sewing thread to use in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Morad

texts.en: Morad is a 26-year-old married man and has two children. He lives in Ibb, Yemen. He is a motorcycle driver who earns a low daily income, which is not enough to cover his family's needs. He owns a small house. He intends to buy new construction supplies to renovate his house. He is requesting for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to cover the cost of purchasing construction supplies in order to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing construction supplies in order to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Née à Tombouctou (Sixième Région administrative de la République du Mali), Madame Aminata est âgée de 41 ans mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni (troisième Région administrative de la République du Mali). Elle mène les activités d’achat et de vente des pagnes de depuis plus de 10 ans. La maîtrise de son activité lui a permis d’être très sollicitée dans la ville. Elle a appris cette activité dès son âge auprès de sa mère. Dans  le cadre du renforcement de son activité et à satisfaire sa clientèle, elle a décidé de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son 2 ème prêt et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé. 
Avec ce prêt  elle achètera 15 pièces de pagnes. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (Capitale de la République du Mali). Ses pagnes sont vendus au comptant et parfois à crédit à des clients composés d’hommes et de femmes de la ville et souvent elle les transportent dans certaines lieux  d’orpaillages.
Elle envisage  réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice elle compte subvenir à ses besoins, payer les intérêts du prêt et à agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Born in Tombouctou (in the sixth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), Aminata is 41 years old, married, and a mother of eight children. She lives with her husband and her children in the Massablacoura neighborhood in the town of Bougouni (in the third administrative region of the Rebublic of Mali).

Aminata has been selling pagnes [brightly colored fabrics] for more than ten years. She runs this business and is very sought-after in the town. She learned this business from her mother. 

In order to strengthen her business and satisfy her customers, she decided to work with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She is on her second loan, and her previous loan has been repaid correctly. With this loan, she will buy 15 lengths of pagne [brightly colored fabric]. She procures her goods in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). Her pagnes are sold for cash and sometimes for credit to men and women customers in town. Often, she also sells her goods in areas where people pan for gold.

With this loan she hopes to earn an average monthly income of 80,000 francs CFA. With these earnings, she expects to support her needs, pay the interest on the loan, and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes [brightly colored fabrics]

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es:
Katherine, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en una habitación alquilada, la misma se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja vendiendo botas para damas de forma ambulante y por las tardes en una pequeña tienda que alquilo,ya que con los pocos ingresos que tiene debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, pago de alquileres y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para aumentar su capital ya que debe renovar modelos y colores para que tenga mas ingresos económicos.
El sueño de Katherine es contar con una tienda propia mas amplia para mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida ya que desea tener mas seguridad y comodidad.
texts.en:
Katherine is single and has no children.  She lives in a rented home, located in the city of a La Paz.

She sells ladies’ boots on foot and in the evenings she works in a small rental shop; she must cover her expenses, food, rent, and basic services, with her small income.

She will use the money from this loan for working capital to buy more styles and colors in order to expand her inventory and also improve her quality of life because she wants to have more comfort and security.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael es casado y tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales tres ya son independientes y solo uno vive con el que esta en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando solo dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como chófer asalariado por mas de ocho horas al día y a veces durante toda la noche,también vende salchipapas en los conciertos o ferias en el coliseo junto a su esposa, es para ese negocio que solicita el crédito ya que desea comprar dos carritos salchipaperos para la venta ya que desean mejorar sus ingresos para poder cubrir los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El sueño de Rafael el construir mas habitaciones para poder acoger a sus hijos los cuales viven en casas alquiladas, desea darles comodidad y seguridad.
texts.en:
Rafael is married and has four children; three of whom are on their own and one who is school aged and lives with him.  They have a two room house located in La Paz.

He currently works as a salaried driver for more than eight hours a day and sometimes all night.  He and his wife also sell salchipapas at concerts or fairs in the coliseum.  He is asking for this loan to buy two salchipapa carts because he wants to increase his income to be able to cover the cost of tuition, food, and pay for basic services.

Rafael’s dream is to build more homes so he can put up his children who currently live in rented homes.  He wants to provide them with comfort and security.

loans.use: to buy a food cart.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en una casa en anticretico ocupando una habitación, la casa se encuentra en la zona Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como empleada por mas de ocho horas al día en una empresa privada y con lo que gana debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de la casa de sus padres ya que la misma se encuentra deteriorada y no cuentan con muchos ingresos ademas de ser ambos de la tercera edad, es por eso que quiere ayudarles a mejorar su calidad de vida y también brindarles comodidad y seguridad.
El sueño de Erika es construir un departamento en la casa de sus padres para poder apoyarlos económicamente y darles mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Erika is single and doesn’t have any children.  She lives in a co-op home in the Miraflores area of La Paz and works for more than eight hours a day as an employee for a private company. 

She needs this loan to make repairs to her parents’ home, which is currently in bad shape.  They don’t have a big income because both are elderly and she wants to help them improve their quality of life and also provide them more security.

Erika’s dream is to build an apartment in her parents’ home so she can support them financially and give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: home repair.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es madre soltera y tiene cuatro hijos, los cuales todos ya son independientes, vive en casa de familiares ocupando solo una habitación pequeña en la ciudad de La Paz
Actualmente se dedica al comercio de ropa de forma ambulante ya que no cuenta con un puesto fijo, tiene que soportar estar todo el día de pie y a veces con mucho frio. Es el único ingreso que tiene ya que ninguno de sus hijos la apoya económicamente.
El crédito lo requiere para aumentar su mercadería ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos para poder pagar su alimentación y servicios básicos.
El sueño de Justina es tener su puesto de venta propio para ya no vender a pie ya que se cansa mucho por que es mayor de edad.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y también con KIVA.
texts.en:
Justina's a single mother with four grown children.  She lives in a house with some relatives in the city of La Paz.

Currently she works as a street vendor selling clothing because she doesn't have a fixed stall.  She has to endure being on her feet all day, sometimes when it's very cold.  It's her only income because none of her children help her financially.

Justina needs the loan to expand her merchandise.  She wants to improve her income so she can pay for her food and basic services.

Justina's dream is to have her own sales stall so she doesn't have to sell on foot anymore.  She gets very tired because she's older.

This is her first time working with IMPRO and with Kiva.

loans.use: to expand her merchandise

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 45 years old, and is from Nakuru. He is married to Keziah who is a housewife and they have five children aged between 23 and 3 years of age.

He has a welding business which has been in operation for the past nine years and he has applied for his first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD which will enable him to buy some welding materials like welding gas, alloy steel metals, valves, electrodes and cutting tools.

His monthly income is 10,000 KES and he will be using the anticipated profits from his expanded business for educating his children. His hopes and dreams are that in the future he will build rental houses for an extra source of income.

loans.use: to buy stock for his welding business.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en: Mwanarusi is a widowed woman with five children who are adults. She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water. Mwanarusi sells makuti (palm leaves) used for thatching roof tops. She has been in this business for the last 10 years and she faces stiff competition from other makuti sellers. With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase more makuti for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support in order to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase makuti (palm leaves) for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a woman who is forty-one years old and married to John. She is the mother of three children. She sells electronics and phone accessories, and has been in this business for seven years now. Jane gets a monthly income of 60,000 KES.

This will be Jane's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy phone accessories for sale. In the future she wants to open another shop.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in New Kru town which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are bit difficult due to the high rate of crime, fewer bathrooms, filthy conditions and overpopulation. Interestingly, the rooms are bit cheaper, one has the option of traveling, the area contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia and food rates are low.

Rebecca is married, and her husband works in a beer factory in Monrovia. They both have four children aged between 15 and 25. Only two of their children currently attend school and live at home. Rebecca was unable to attend school, but she started a table market business where she bakes and sells bread. With the loan proceeds she will buy flour, sugar and oil to increase her sales. Her problem is fewer goods on her table. She has no additional problems for now. With a little money from her husband she managed to established this business, and learned by observing other businesswomen ten years ago. She stated that she enjoys the fast buying from costumers. She dreams of moving from a table business to a shop business and to improve her children's lives.

loans.use: she will buy flour, sugar and oil to increase her sales.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a mother of four children. One child is in school. The rest are adults. She lives in a rented house with electricity and piped water. 

Christine operates a tailor shop and has been in this business for over two years. Her major challenge is seasonality.

She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust to receive financial support. With a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase fabric, materials and thread for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, materials and thread for her business

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza is a nurse with many years of experience. She works at a local clinic in Artashat town, where she lives with her husband. 

Tereza's monthly salary is hardly enough to cover the family's basic costs. To tackle financial hardship, she has also been involved in agriculture for five years. Jointly with her husband, Tereza keeps chickens, turkeys and pigs. The couple also owns two greenhouses, where they cultivate haricots, tomatoes and greens and grow different types of trees (peach, apricot, nut and apple). Agriculture is the family's main source of income. 

Tereza has applied for this loan to purchase an ox, grass for feeding it and compressed forage for her livestock. This loan will greatly help Tereza to feed her livestock and continue her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for an ox, grass for feeding it and compressed forage for her livestock

loans.name: Vivian

texts.es:
Vivian esta separada del esposo, tiene dos hijas con las cuales vive en casa propia en la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente trabaja vendiendo artesanias, el esposo le pasa una asistencia familiar para sus hijas, el credito que solicita es para construir un garage en su domiclio, con el cual ella podra generar un ingresos adicional que le permita solventar sus minimos gastos tanto de alimentacion y estudios de ella y de sus hijas.

El sueño de Vivian es darles una profesion a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Vivian is separated from her husband. She has two daughters with whom she lives in her own home in the city of La Paz.

Right now she works selling artisanal crafts. Her husband gives her child support for her daughters. The loan she is taking out is to build a garage at her house. With it, she will be able to generate some additional income that will allow her to pay her minimal expenses such as food and education for her and her daughters.

Vivian's dream is to help her daughter's have good careers.

loans.use: to build a garage at her house.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is divorced and has six children. After successfully graduating vocational school, Ekua is now an established businesswoman. She sells meats and pineapples in a location near Cape Coast. She has been actively involved in this business for about two years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ekua uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Ekua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of meat and pineapples, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of meat and pineapples

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Antonia una mujer emprendedora, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, desde hace muchos años se dedica a trabajar la Tierra, sembrando Piñas, Pitahaya. pero con esta actividad no podia realizar sus metas y logros, como mejorar su vivienda y sobre todo mejorar sus condiciones de vida. desde hace ya un año ella vende frutas y verduras en un tramito y gracias a Dios  le esta llendo muy bien ya que sus ingresos han aumentado y sus familia junto con ella se sienten felices, con este nuevo credito la señora Antonia invertira en su inventario comprando mas frutas y verdura ademas quiere darle un pequeño Mantenimiento a su puesto de venta. muy contenta agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado todos estos años.
texts.en:
Antonia, an enterprising woman, lives in the Ticuantepe municipality.  She has been working the land for many years.  She grows pineapples and dragon fruit.  However, with this business activity she was not able to meet her goals like improving her house, and most of all, her living conditions.  She has been selling fruit and vegetables at a stall.  Thanks to God, it is going very well for her.  Her income has increased, and her family is happy.

With this new loan Antonia will invest in her inventory by purchasing more fruits and vegetables.  She also wants to do a little maintenance work on her sales stand.  She is very happy and grateful for the support that AFODENIC and Kiva have given her all of these years.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Las Millonarias Del Dorado Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Sila Elva, tiene 48 años de edad, es viuda. Ella forma parte del grupo "Las Millonarias del Dorado", formado por siete socios, ellos mismos eligieron su nombre ya que es uno de sus deseos poder llegar a esa condición económica para lo cual se esfuerzan mucho con su trabajo.
Desde hace año y medio Sila Elva se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por medio de catálogos, es un negocio que le permite elegir horarios y conocer gente, le agrada mucho este negocio y procura aumentar su clientela en cada campaña.
Sila Elva, invertirá el préstamo recibido en la compra de perfumes que se encuentran en promoción en el catalogo actual con lo cual le permitirá tener un stock de productos y obtener un mayor margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
Sila Elva is 48 years old. She is a widow. She is a part of the "Las Millonarias del Dorado" [The Dorado Millionaires] group, made up of seven members. She picked the name themselves, since one of the things they want is reach that financial condition, and to do that they work hard. 

For a year and a half, Sila Elva has sold beauty products via catalogues. It is a business that allows her to choose her schedule and meet people. She really likes this business and always tries to grow her clientele.

Sila Elva will invest the loan she receives in buying perfumes that are on sale right now in the present catalog. This will allow her to stock products and obtain a bigger profit margin.

loans.use: to invest in buying beauty products.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
40-year-old Victoria lives in New Kru town which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are bit difficult due to the high rate of criminals, fewer bathrooms,  filthy conditions, and over-population, but the most interesting part is that rooms are a bit cheaper, there are options for traveling, the area contain one of the biggest markets in Liberia,  and food is less expensive.    

Victoria is single and has five children whose ages are between 23 and 18; only one of her children is currently attending school and lives at home. Victoria was unfortunate not to attend school, but she is busy running her shop which sells charcoal in the local  market. 

With the loan proceeds she will buy more charcoal for her business. She said, "Besides few goods on my table market, I have no other problems for now." With a little money from her mother, she managed to established this business six years ago, and learned from seeing other businesswomen. She stated, "I enjoy the flow of customers and the fast buying.  My dreams are to move from the charcoal business to a store business, and live a better life in future."

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 42 years old and she lives with her family in Kapan city. She is married and she has two children. Her daughter is married and she lives separately with her family. Her son is 22 years old and he works as a worker at a construction company. Anahit and her husband are also employed. 

Recently Anahit’s son had a car accident in which fortunately nobody was injured, but as you can see in photo, their car was damaged greatly and it needs serious repairs. 

Anahit asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams since they need to repair their car, but they have no enough money for it.

loans.use: to repair their personal car

loans.name: Carlos Amilcar

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 21 años de edad, casado con un hijo.  Se dedica a la venta de pan en su motocicleta desde hace 5 años. Antes se dedicaba al trabajo de la agricultura. El pan que él vende, son de la panadería que se encuentra a unos 20 minutos de su cantón del cual es empleado.
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para construir  un muro perimetral y realizar unas mejoras en su casa. Con el crédito, podrá hacer un muro para dividir su propiedad con la del vecino y tener mas privacidad, y poner ladrillo de piso en su casa; ya que actualmente el piso es de tierra, y el niño camina en el suelo que no es muy saludable para él.

Su objetivo, es trabajar duro y pagar rápido el préstamo, para tramitar un crédito mas grande y poder ampliar mas  su casa.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 21 year old man. He is married and has one son. He has sold bread from his motorcycle for 5 years. Previously, he worked in farming. The bread he sells is from a bread bakery that is 20 minutes from his canton and he is an employee. 

The loan he is asking for is to build a wall around his property and to some home improvement. With the loan, he will be able to build a wall to divide his property from his neighbor's and have more privacy, as well as put in a brick floor in his house. Right now, it has a dirt floor and his son walks on the floor and it isn't very healthy for him. 

His goal is to work hard and pay off the loan quickly in order to take out a bigger loan and make his house bigger.

loans.use: to build a wall around the property and do some home improvement.

loans.name: Athman

texts.en:
Athman lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is a married man with two children. He has been selling cooked food for the last three years and this is his full-time business. He has employed two people to help run the business and this has seen his business grow. 

Athman learned about Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy foodstuffs and utensils for the business. The challenge in the business is that most people want to eat on credit and refuse to pay. The extra income that he will raise will help him pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and utensils

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en:
Joanna lives in New Kru town. She is 45 years old, single, and she has three children between 13 and 20 years old. They are in school and live at home. Joanna was unfortunate unable to attend school, but she has been keeping herself busy with her business over the past 4 years by selling water in the local market. 

She started this business with a little money from her mother. She said; fewer items on her table to sell are the only challenge she faces. She likes her business because it is affordable and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She mentions, "I am proud of my business because it is the only means my family is surviving." With the loan she is going to buy more water to resell.  Her plan is to increase her sales even more.

loans.use: to buy more water to resell.

loans.name: Jartu

texts.en:
Jartu lives in Paynesville South Area. She is 45 years old and is married with five children between 19 and 30. Only one is in school and lives at home. 

For the past three years, she has been selling charcoal. She says she is proud of her business because of her daily savings. It was her oldest brother who help her to start this business with a little amount of money.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to expand her business. In future, she wants to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Jaime Arturo

texts.es:
Jaime es un hombre de 44 años de edad. Aprendió el trabajo de la agricultura y ganadería, desde temprana edad, ya que su familia siempre se a dedicado a esa actividad productiva el cual a sido el sustento familiar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar pesticidas, herbicidas, abonos, vitaminas, medicamentos, harina, sal, para el ganado. Con el préstamo, podrá darle mejor mantenimiento a sus potreros, sembrara mas pastos y  podrá dar mejor cuido a sus animales.

Con el mejor mantenimiento a los terrenos, al ganado y cerdos, podrá vender a mejores precios los animales y obtener mejores ingresos económicos y así poder cubrir algunas necesidades de su familia.

Él desea, con los ingresos instalar un comedor en el pueblo, comprar más ganado y cerdos.
texts.en:
Jaime, age 44, learned to farm and work with livestock at an early age.  This is because his family always did this productive work, which was the family’s support.

The loan that he is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to buy pesticides, herbicides, fertilizers, vitamins, medications, flour, and salt for his livestock.  With the loan he will be able to improve the maintenance of his pastures.  

He will plant more grass, and he will be able to improve the care of his animals.  With the improved maintenance of the land, he will be able to sell his animals for better prices and get better income.  This way he will be able to cover some of his family’s necessities.

With the income he wishes to set up an eatery in the village and to buy more cattle and pigs.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, herbicides, fertilizers, vitamins, medications, flour, and salt for his livestock.

loans.name: Benetta

texts.en:
Benetta lives in New Kru town. She is 28 years old, married, and has three children between 7 and 9 years old. They are in school and live at home. 

Benetta did not go to school, so she decided to keep herself busy with business by selling foodstuffs like palm oil, rice, etc. to improve her life. She started this business with a little money from her husband two years ago. She said that few goods on her table is the only challenge she faces now. She likes her business because it is affordable, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She said, "I am proud of my business because it is the only means I have to help my children. Benetta said that with the loan she is going to buy more palm oil, rice, etc. to resell. Her plan is to increase her sales even more.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, rice, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with two children who are still underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past one year, she has operated a business of selling 'leso' ( women's wrap) cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of cloth in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase 40 lengths of 'lesos'  for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 40 lengths of 'Lesos' (women's wrap) for resale.

loans.name: Elamie

texts.en:
Elamie is 41 years old and lives in Paynesville South Area which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and her husband is a driver. Together they have five children between 12 and 20 years old; they are currently in school and live at home.

For the past thirty years she has been selling charcoal in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has lots of customers since her business is in a very good location. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal bags for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more coal bags for her business.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives in Nor Ughi village of Ararat region with her two grown-up children and husband.

Karine works at the local post office and together with her family has been involved in agriculture for eight years. Currently Karine keeps livestock (cows, pigs, turkeys and calves). Near the village where the family lives, Karine owns a plot of land where different type of fruits and vegetables are cultivated (greens, peaches, apricots, plums, nuts, apples and pears). Karine's husband sells the gathered harvest in the local villages and so provides income for the family's well-being.

In order to overcome financial difficulties that family currently is facing, Karine's son went abroad to find a well-paid job to sustain his family. 

Realizing the importance of agricultural income, Karine would like to expand her farm. She has applied for this loan in order to purchase two oxen and forage to feed her livestock. The loan will greatly assist Karine and her family to enlarge their farm and gather more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy two oxen and forage to feed her livestock.

location.town: Nor Ughi village of Ararat region

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope is 41 years old and lives in the town of Maganjo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Hope has been working hard to manage her poultry farm. 

To help expand her business, Hope has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chicken feed for the farm and will help Hope to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children and build rental houses. Hope believes that in the future she will be able to add more chickens to the farm to expand it more. 

Hope is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hope who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken feed for the farm

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 32 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has five children with three of them currently in school. For the past two years, Peter has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, maize flour, rice and water. 

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items such as maize flour, sugar and rice to sell in the shop. This will help Peter to generate greater profits and take care of his children and other basic needs. Peter hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business into a supermarket. 

Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peter who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as maize flour, sugar and rice to sell in the shop.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is the mother of two children who go to school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
