loans.use: to buy make-up, perfume, clothing, and shoes

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru: Светлана - удивительная женщина, замечательная домохозяйка и просто прекрасный человек. В жизне Светланы есть два замечательных людей, которые всегда ее подержат и придут на помощь. Конечно же, это ее дети. У нее есть взрослый сын, он уехал на заработки, но не прекращает связи. У Светланы есть красивая дочь, она работает продавщицей на местном магазине. Сама Светлана живет в районе Дж.Руми. Ей 47 лет. «Начать никогда, не поздно» - сказав Светлана, решила открыть свой бизнес "Откорм-продажа скота". Она уже составила свой мини бизнес-план и собирается заниматься этим во дворе своего дома. Она просит кредит, чтобы закупить коров и телят, чтобы начать бизнес. Надеемся у нее все получиться.
texts.en: Svetlana is a remarkable woman, an excellent housekeeper and simply a wonderful person. In her life there are two persons who will always support and help her—of course, it is her children. Sveltana has a grown son who is currently a migrant worker elsewhere but remains in touch. Svetlana also has a  good-looking daughter who works as a salesperson in a local store. Svetala lives in the J. Rumi region. "It’s never too late to have a fresh start,” said Svetlana and decided to launch her own livestock business. She has already drafted a mini business plan and intends to grow livestock in the backyard of her home. She is requesting a credit to buy cows and calves for launching her business. We hope that she will succeed.

loans.use: to buy cattle for launching her business.

loans.name: Koffigan

texts.fr: Mr Koffigan pour subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille, revend depuis 2009 des pneus dans un quartier de Lomé. Il est marié et père d'un enfant de 1an 06 mois. Afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, il sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des pneus. Il espère ouvrir un second point de vente et mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Il est âgé de 24ans.
texts.en: Koffigan is a 24-year-old married father of a 1.5-year-old child. He has been selling tires in Lomé since 2009 to provide for his family. To better meet the needs of his customers, he is seeking a loan from Kiva field partner WAGES to buy tires. Koffigan hopes to eventually open a second shop and better meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase tires.

loans.name: Alex Javier

texts.es: Alex, tiene 27 años, esta soltero, vive con sus padres y cuatro hermanos en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá. Alex tiene 5 años de hacer sus cultivos de papa en un terreno que alquila. La producción que saca es por ciclos y la vende en el mercado local de la zona. Esa zona es apta para la producción de papa y otros cultivos. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 17,000 Lempiras para poder comprar abonos, insecticidas y otros insumos para sembrar papa. Este préstamo le ayuda a capitalizarse a poder realizar el cultivo tecnificado para sacar buenas cosechas. Su plan es poder sacar buenas ganancias de esta inversión.
texts.en: Alex is 27, single and lives with his parents and four siblings in a community in the municipality of Intibucá. For five years Alex has been planting potatoes in a plot that he rents. He obtains his production cyclically and sells it in the local market of the region.This region is favorable for the production of potatoes and other crops. He has decided to seek a loan of 17,000 lempiras in order to buy fertilizer, insecticide and other supplies for planting potatoes. This loan will help him obtain capital in order to use modern crop methods and obtain good harvests. His plan is to get a good return for this investment.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizer and insecticide for planting potatoes

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques, les dix membres du groupe Danaya ont en moyenne 44 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Kalaban Coro chef lieu de commune dans le cercle de Kati (dans la 2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kalaban Coro. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de poissons frais et de pagnes wax. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Karata (femme debout en 1ère position sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) est connue dans le marché de Kalaban Coro pour la vente de poissons frais de gros calibres. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 130 kg de poissons frais avec les pêcheurs. Elle se ravitaille à Kabala avec les pêcheurs au bord du fleuve Niger et parfois à Koulikoro.  La revente se fait en détails au marché de Kalaban Coro à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Karata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité afin d’augmenter son volume dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Danaya Group are predominantly married women living in monogamous families with an average age of 44 years old and five children. They all live in the village of Kalaban Coro in the cercle of Kati (in the second administrative region of Mali) and know each other through their activities at the Kalaban Coro market. The members of the group trade fresh fish and wax cloth. In order to increase their financial resources, they decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan. 

Mrs. Karata (the woman standing at the left in the photo) is known in the Kalaban Coro market for selling large, fresh fish. She plans to use this loan to buy 130kg of fresh fish from fishermen. She re-stocks mainly in Kabala with fishermen who work along the Niger River and sometimes at Koulikoro. She resells the fish at the Kalaban Coro market, primarily to women customers. With this loan and the support of Soro Yiriwaso, Mrs. Karata hopes to generate an average monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and increase its volume.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish.

loans.name: Inacia

texts.en:
Inacia has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as soap, glue, biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, motorcycle oil and motorcycle tires to sell. Inacia has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Inacia independent because she can be responsible for herself and is also helping her family. A $600 loan is offered to Inacia to improve her business. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy soap, glue, biscuits, noodles, sugar,  coffee, motorcycle oil and motorcycle tires to sell

loans.name: Bagdad

texts.en:
Bagdad now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. He is 48 years old, married, and has a son who goes to school. Bagdad is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fuzuli city. 

Bagdad started his new business five years ago. Now he needs a loan of 1,000 AZN to buy food products for his store (cheese, milk, tea, sweets, rice, etc.). He wants to use the profits for his son's future. 

In the future, Bagdad wants to buy a new fridge for his shop. This will be more profitable for his business. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy food products for his store

loans.name: Rose Mary

texts.en:
Rose Mary is 33 years old and lives in the town of Entebbe in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past 16 years, Rose Mary has been working hard to manage her charcoal business which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Rose Mary has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy cement and sand to renovate her rentals and also to buy more stock for her charcoal business. This will help Rose Mary to generate greater profits and to receive more money from rent and charcoal and, hence, an improved standard of living. Rose Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to attract more tenants and buyers thus receiving high sales and increased profits. 

Rose Mary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but who have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.


"

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to renovate her rentals and also to buy more stock for her charcoal business

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia, aged 39, lives with her husband and five children in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband provides services in which he changes vehicles' seat covers.  He purchases ready-made seat covers and also stitches them.  His shop is situated in the vehicles' workshop market. He has to capture his customers one by one and convince them to change their seat covers.

His business is going very well because he is expert and professional in his arts. He does not take much of his customers' time and quickly changes the seat covers. Previously, he was only providing services for motorbike seats; now he wants to provide services for various cars as well. For this purpose, he wants to buy various colors and types of Rexine (artificial leather fabric) so that he can also use his arts for car seats.

Fozia feels proud of her husband and is living very happily. However, she wants to financially help her husband by taking out a loan. Therefore, Fozia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy various types of Rexine.

Fozia says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy Rexine (artificial leather fabric) for poshish (seat cover) replacement in vehicles.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana's previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy the needed spare parts and accessories for her jeepney. Her income from the business was a big help in her children's education and in their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of their jeepney. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosana hopes to have another jeepney and dreams of being successful in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her life and business every week and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies there. 

*Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers in helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese forces. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney: open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of their jeepney.

loans.name: Lauren

texts.es: Lauren, tiene la edad  de 20 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y su hijo los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de maíz de buena calidad con un alto porcentaje de germinación y que se adapte bien a la condiciones de clima y condiciones de suelo, fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle en el momento de la siembra, además pagar mano de obra para la siembra y aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Lauren is 20 years old and married. She lives with her husband and child, who are her main priorities.

She plans to use the loan to purchase corn seeds which are of good quality, have a high germination rate, and which grow well in varying climate and soil conditions. She would also purchase fertilizers and other products to use at planting time, and pay for the manual labor needed during planting, application of fertilizers and other products, and once the crop is ready. This will allow her to do the job well. 

Lauren would like to take advantage of the good climate conditions and soil in this area, and wants to put into practice several years of experience handling basic grains. She would like to be able to buy the best quality products so that she can cultivate her field well and have a good harvest. In the short term, she would like a significant output. 

Lauren hopes to use the income from the crop to ensure the well-being and education of her family, fulfill some familial obligations, and continue investing in farming. 

This is the first loan that Lauren is receiving from FUDECOSUR. She has never had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her the loan without any difficulty and with a much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to grow corn.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is 26 years old, married with two school-age daughters and lives in the Kaspi district. Ludmila’s parents-in-law live with them as well. The only one who earns money is Ludmila’s husband who works as the financial department manager at the local pharmacy. He earns a small monthly salary which is not enough to make ends meet for a family of six. 

Ludmila is jobless. There is a high unemployment rate in the region, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. Therefore, Ludmila decided to start a clothing trading business with a loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from borrowers.  Ludmila’s credit requests were rejected several times as she did not satisfy their requirements. 

She then received the loan within the framework of the Startup Program, a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  With the loan of $600, Ludmila will purchase clothing at wholesale prices in Turkey and sell them in her community door-to-door.  She plans to sell a wide assortment of well-priced clothing for men, women and children.  It is obvious that this job will be hard for Ludmila, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually. The Startup loan will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Polqueria

texts.en:
Polqueria is 65 years old, married with three children. She is a businesswoman from Ozamiz City who busies herself by running a sari-sari (variety) store. 

She has enjoyed her membership with PMPC since 2007 and considers the institution as her financial partner. Now, Polqueria is requesting another loan to purchase more stocks such as basic commodities for her sari-sari store.

She hopes to save for family emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks such as basic commodities for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Sabiniana

texts.en:
Sabiniana is a married woman and the mother of three grown-up children. She lives with her family in the town of San Miguel, Bohol.  Sabiniana has been running a grinder and steel cutting business together with her husband for more than 17 years. This is the source of their income.

Sabiniana is asking for a loan to buy equipment like a grinder and a steel cutter. With this, they will be able to cater to more customers in their shop thus augmenting their income.

In the future, Sabiniana hopes to make their business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy equipment like a grinder and a steel cutter

loans.name: Musingi Bora Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ngashani est conseillère du collectif d’affaire « Musingi bora»,senior entrepreneur,expérimentée et  mère de 9 enfants parmi les quels 2 étudient et d’autres ont déjà leurs foyers. Son conjoint est un enseignant dans une école officielle. La cliente est vendeuse des Manioc. Elle installe ses marchandises  dans un dépôt. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a environ 5 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau crédit va lui servir d’acheter 5 sacs de manioc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses  enfants.  Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: Our client Ngashani is the leader of the Musingi bora lenders’ group. She is a senior entrepreneur, with plenty of experience. She has nine children: two of  them are in school, and the others already have their own families. Her husband is a teacher at a public school. Ngashani sells manioc (cassava). She keeps her merchandise in a warehose. She launched her business with her own funds received from her husband. Later on she obtained a loan from Hekima. She has been in this business for about five years. This new loan will allow her to buy five bags of manioc. She would like to  develop her business and provide for the education and nutrition of her children. Finally, she cordially thanks Herkima for its microloan program in support of small businesses.

loans.use: to buy five bags of cassava.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nadr

texts.en:
Nadr is a 20-year-old man. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. Nadr`s business is a grocery store which he started running two years ago with limited capital from his dad. It is the main source of income for feeding his family. Although he has been working hard, he can't meet his customers' requirements due to limited capital, as wholesalers require cash payments before providing him with grocery supplies. 

Nadr has managed to attract more clients. Although happy about attracting new clients, on the other hand, the financial challenge of meeting customers' demands is hindering his business progress and growth. So, Nadr has taken out a loan of 100,000 YER in order to purchase the grocery supplies that his shop needs.

loans.use: to purchase the grocery supplies that his shop needs.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita, aged 37, is a married woman with five children aged from four to 19. She is from the community of Garcia-Hernandez, Bohol. 

For the past eight years, Carmelita has been engaged in raising pigs and selling clothes. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy piglets, feed and supplements. She is determined to make her business successful so she can sustain the needs of her family. 

In the future, Carmelita hopes to have a bigger house, a piggery with quite a number of pigs, and successful children.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and supplements

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando, es viudo y vive en casa propia en  la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe una renta de jubilación con la cual debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para invertirlo en un tratamiento médico que necesita con urgencia ya que es mayor de edad y no recibe apoyo económico de nadie, sus ingresos no le alcanzan para cubrir los gastos de medicamentos ni exámenes.
texts.en:
Orlando is a widower and lives in his own home in the city of La Paz.  He currently receives a retirement pension, which he uses to cover the cost of food and basic services.  

The loan he is requesting will be invested in urgent medical treatment that he needs because he is of advanced age.  Orlando does not receive financial support from anyone.  His income is not enough to cover the cost of medicines or examinations.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment.

loans.name: Nuria

texts.es: Nuria, tiene la edad  de 32 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y sus hijos los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de maíz de buena calidad, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Nuria is 32 years old and is married. She lives with her husband and children, who are her first priority. With her loan she intends to purchase fertilizer and other products to apply to the crops. In this way she will have good germination and good quality corn seed. In addition she will pay the labour for the application of the products and help in the field once it is growing. In this way she will ensure that she performs a good job. She intends to take advantage of the good climate and soil conditions of this region for her crop, and also use the experience that she has gained from several years of management of basic grains. As well, she will be able to buy better quality products so that her fields have good development and health as well as a favorable harvest, and a significant production in the short term. 

She will use the income that she hopes to obtain from the harvest for the comfort and studies of her family and will complete some family goals and continue investing more in the crops. 

This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has never obtained previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has granted her the loan more easily and with a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to plant corn.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est composé de 2 femmes monogames et 2 polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Kalaban Coro chef lieu de commune dans le cercle de Kati (dans la 2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, produits alimentaires (pâtes alimentaires, couscous arabe, crevette, mayonnaise, boites de sardine, huile d’arachide ou de coco, boites de lait sucré, …), du bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Maimouna (femme assise en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits alimentaires de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 sacs  de pâtes alimentaires en gros au grand marché de Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Kalaban Coro à une clientèle mixte. Madame Maimouna espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The Danaya Group consists of two monogamous and two polygamous women.  They have an average age of 34 and 4 children each.  They all live in the village of Kalaban Coro, the main commune in the Kati circle (in the second largest administrative region of Mali).  They know each other through neighborhood ties.  The group members are small business owners selling food products (pasta, Arab couscous, shrimp, mayonnaise, canned sardines, peanut and coconut oil, boxes of sweetened milk, etc.), firewood and charcoal.  In order to increase their working capital, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan.  Ms. Maimouna (woman sitting in second position from right to left in the photo) is well-known for the sale of food products of all kinds.  She plans to use her loan to buy 20 bags of pasta wholesale at the large market in Bamako.  Retail resale will happen in Kalaban Coro to a mix of customers.  With this loan, Ms. Maimouna hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA that will be reinvested in her business.  In this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso, her goal is to buy a residential lot.

loans.use: to buy pasta.

loans.name: Norma Nohemi

texts.es: Norma Nohemí de 21 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos de 2 y 5 años de edad. Actualmente vende verduras como güisquil, ayote, pipián y zanahorias en una zona conocida de su comunidad. Su esposo trabaja como jornalero en una hacienda, realizando trabajos de siembra. Juntos les está costando salir adelante pero por sus pequeños hijos los está motiva seguir adelante. Norma a solicitado un préstamo a FUSAI para la compra de lamina galvanizada, pines y otros materiales de construcción con el fin de reparar el techo de su humilde vivienda pues la que tienen está muy deteriorada, las lluvias ya han comenzado a afectarles filtrándose el agua y está arruinando sus pocas pertenencias.
texts.en:
Norma Nohemí is 21 years old and lives with her husband and their two small children (ages 2 and 5).  She currently sells vegetables such as chayote, acorn squash, pumpkins, and carrots in a recognized area of her community.  Her husband works as a day laborer on an estate where he engages in planting crops.  Together they have been able to get by, but they are motivated to continue forward for the sake of their young children.  

Norma is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can buy galvanized sheets, bolts, and other construction materials that she needs to repair the roof of her modest house which has deteriorated.  Rain has started to seep through and is ruining a few of her belongings.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for repairing the roof of her house.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam esta separada del esposo, vive en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actual mente trabaja en la Federación de Jubilados donde percibe una renta con la cual se mantiene y cubre sus gastos mínimos, el crédito que solicita es para poder efectuar un examen medico ya que el seguro no cubre ciertos gastos médicos.
texts.en:
Miriam is separated from her husband.  She lives in the city of La Paz.  Miriam currently works for the retirement board, where she receives a salary that she uses to support herself and cover minimal expenses.  

The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for a doctor’s exam since her insurance does not cover certain medical expenses.

loans.use: to pay for a medical exam.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is very thankful for the financial help extended to her. She is using her loans as additional capital for her business. She is selling different kinds of fruits and vegetables. Her income from business is helping send her children to school and is assisting their everyday household expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan for her to purchase more fruits and vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Yolanda dreams to put up another branch and hopes that her family will always be in good health. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God. 


* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. Fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fruit and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem (pictured here), age 40, stays at home and does housework. She lives in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She just has a young son.  

The main source of income is from her husband, who is a motor taxi driver. Now, Khem wants to launch a tailoring business which would enable her to earn extra income. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Archil

texts.en:
Archil is a 29-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, two children and parents and grandmother in the small village of Kobuleti district. His grandmother is provided with a retirement pension. Archil has been involved in the agricultural business from early childhood, as his parents were farmers and this is a traditional activity for the family. 

Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Archil was unable to study a professional career. Archil works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing maize and nut trees. He always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. Besides this, he has a milking cow and produces dairy products to sell. 

As the family has only seasonal income, Archil decided to start his own business and sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $3,500. With the received credit, he will purchase a minibus and transport people. This will give him a chance to generate stable income and improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and transport people.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
This is Liza, 43, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Cresencio, a tricycle driver. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Liza operates a food stall. She sells pancakes, cool drinks, turon (a Filipino snack made of thinly sliced bananas and a slice of jackfruit, dusted with brown sugar, rolled in a spring roll wrapper and fried), pancit or noodles and other snack foods.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy different ingredients for the different products that she sells in her food stall.

Liza dreams that her business will continue to expand and hopes that they will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different ingredients needed in her food stall.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 52 years old and lives in the Baghdati district with her husband, grown son, daughter-in-law and granddaughter. Maia’s husband works at the local cleaning company and gets a small monthly salary. Maia runs a small-scale agricultural business, growing various vegetables on the family-owned plot of land. She works hard, but the family earnings are not enough for covering daily expenditures. 

Maia applied for credit for starting a car wash with her business partner. She will purchase essential equipment and a vacuum cleaner. Her son will help her run the business. They will provide services to local community members and hope to increase the monthly income of the family. Her new business initiative will generate income and significantly improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase essential equipment for starting a car wash.

loans.name: Enecita

texts.en:
Enecita is 56 years old. She is a widow with one child. She sells vegetables for a living. 

She has maintained her membership with PMPC in good standing. Now she is requesting a loan to purchase additional kilos of vegetables to sell. She hopes to expand her business someday.

loans.use: to purchase additional kilos of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Dong

texts.en:
Dong was born in 1993. He lives in Bac Ninh Province. He learns as a Automotive Technology major at Ha Noi University of Industry (http://haui.edu.vn/en). His course lasts 30 months, and he will be graduated in 2014. His education fee is subsidized by his parents. Dong plans to find a part-time job to have more money to pay for his education’s fee. Dong’s family has four members. He is the first person in his family that has a higher education. His parents grow rice to earn a living. His mother is with him in the posted photo. 

His family’s income is about 5,000,000 VND (Vietnamese dong) per month. He is aware that this major is suitable for himself, so he has a passion for his major. He wants to follow it until the end of this university’s course. He understands that learning helps him have qualifications to get a high-paid job and bring income for his family. 

He wants to borrow 14,580,000 VND to buy a computer to support his studying. If he couldn’t access this loan, his studying must be interrupted. He appreciates the help of people all around the world whose are raising funds for this kind of program. This has supported a lot the education of students in Vietnam. He also hopes this program could be expanded more to help more students.

loans.use: to buy a computer to support his studying.

loans.name: Mat

texts.en:
Mat and his wife fish for a living because it’s a traditional profession and business. He lives in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City and has six children. Two are married, one works for a slaughter house, another one assists his parents in the fishing business and the other two are in school. 

Mat is requesting a loan. He will use the money from the loan to repair his boat motor and to buy some new fishing equipment.

loans.use: To repair his boat motor and to buy some new fishing equipment.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en: Jerome is 34 years old, married and the father of school-aged children. He is a farmer who plants and harvests rice to sell. He usually gets PHP 15,000 average net income each harvest season twice a year. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticides for the maintenance of his crop. This will help maintain good crop production in his farming by the next cropping season. Having this will lead Jerome to generate a bigger income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for the maintenance of his crop.

loans.name: Zahrat Al-Rabea Group

texts.en: This group is called Zahrat Al-Rabea and consists of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. Kfaya is 27 years old. She studied at university. She is a hardworking and enthusiastic person who very much wants to succeed. She is living under bad situations with her family and intends to assist them to buy home improvements. So, she applied for a youth loan of 50,000 YER to buy furniture for her home. The group's members hope for their loan to be funded by kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her home.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha was born in 1992. She lives in Bac Ninh. She has a literary and geographical major at Thai Nguyen University of Education (http://dhsptn.edu.vn/).  Her course lasts 48 months and she will graduate in 2014. Her education fee is subsidized by her parents. Ha plans to find a part-time job to have much money to pay for her education fee. Ha’s family has nine members. She is the first person in her family who has a higher education. Her parents grow rice and do breeding to earn a living. Her mother had her picture taken with Ha in the posted photo. Her family’s income is about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

She has a passion for her major because she is aware that this job is the most honourable of all jobs. She wants to follow till the end of this university’s course. She understands that learning helps her have qualifications to get a high-paid job, bring income for her family and contribute a little part to the country’s education. She wants to borrow 14,580,000 VND to pay for her education fee. Because her family has many siblings, if she couldn’t access this loan, her studying must be interrupted. She appreciates the help of people all around the world who are raising funds for this kind of program. This has been supporting a lot of the education of students in Vietnam. She also hopes this program could be expanded more to help more students.

loans.use: to pay for her education fee.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira vive en una casa como cuidadora, tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde elabora prendas de vestir de mujer como también arreglos de toda prenda de vestir su vivienda esta ubicada en la zona miraflores de la cuidad de La Paz. Necesita crédito para comprar más insumos para su taller de costura 

Su microempresa le permite generar ingresos para solventar todos sus gastos 

El sueño de Elvira es tener un taller de costura donde tenga la posibilidad de ofrecer a su clientela productos terminados de mejor calidad y así poder generar mayores ingresos para su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elvira lives in a home as a caretaker.  She has a small sewing workshop where she makes women’s clothing and repairs.  Her home is in the Miraflores area of La Paz.  She needs a loan to buy more supplies for her workshop.  Her small business allows her to generate income to pay her expenses.

Elvira’s dream is to have a workshop where she can offer her clients high quality finished products, so she can generate greater income for her family’s wellbeing and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Celia Iveth

texts.es:
Celia  tiene 21 años de edad , vive en con su compañero de vida en la parte baja de la laguna; su compañero de vida, es pescador artesanal y  trabaja en la agricultura cultivando maíz con su papá. Celia, por su parte se dedica a vender pescado fresco, que pesca su compañero de vida y cuidando a su hijo de 4 años de edad. 

Ella,  solo estudio 4to grado en la escuela , luego se fue a vivir con una tía, cuando tenia 14 años de edad estudio un curso técnico de cosmetología y de 17 años se acompaño.    

 Celia posee un  negocio de pescado fresco a la orilla de la laguna, junto con su suegra que le venden a los visitantes y turistas ella ya maneja un préstamo KIVA que lo ocupo para un negocio de meriendas en su casa;  pero ya no lo maneja por su estado de embarazo, la cliente se a dedicado a actividades de comercio desde que se vino para donde su tía y lo aprendió de ella. Ahora le sirve de mucho comenta. Con esto ayudo a cubrir los gastos de la casa ya que solo de la pesca no alcanza.

El préstamo  que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar materiales, para construir una habitación a parte, enfrente de la casa de su suegra. Lo que pretende es  evitar causar molestias ,cuando nazca el bebé. Sera algo humilde la habitación por ahora ,  ya que en la parte baja de la laguna, no se puede estar tan cómodos porque cuando los inviernos son copiosos  el nivel de la laguna sube e inunda las casas de la orilla  y hay que salir deprisa.

Sus deseos, son manejar bien los dos prestamos de forma responsable, del primero la suegra le ayuda con las cuotas y de este con su trabajo mas lo que gana su compañero de vida en la pesca.  También, desea estabilizarse para cuando crezcan sus hijos construir una casa mejor en una zona segura que no se duerma con el temor de hay que salir de emergencia por alguna inundación, que estudien los niños y darles lo necesario siempre.
texts.en:
Celia is 21 years old and lives with her life’s partner at the lower end of the lake.  Her husband is a fisherman and also farms corn with his father.  Celia sells the fresh fish that her husband fishes and she also cares for her four year old son.

She only has a fourth grade education and then went to live with her aunt when she was 14.  She studied at the cosmetology school and married at age 17.

Celia has a fresh fish business on the edge of the lake, in partnership with her mother in law, and they sell to the tourists and visitors.  She already manages a Kiva loan and uses it for a food business in her home, but she is not working it at the moment because of her pregnancy.  She has been in business since she went to live where her aunt was and learned from her and this has been very helpful for her.  This helps her cover her household expenses because the income from fish sales is not enough.

She is asking for a loan through Fundación Campo to buy building materials to build a separate house, across from her mother in law’s.  She is trying to keep from bothering her when the baby is born.  It will be a humble home for the time being, because one can’t be too comfortable at the lower part of the lake due to the level rising and the homes flooding during the winter.

She wants to manage her loans responsibly.  Her mother in law is helping her repay the first one and her husband will help her with this one.  She also wants to be set up for when her children are grown, so she can build a better house in a safe area so that they don’t have to make any emergency exits because of floods.  She wants the children to attend school and give them the best always.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr: Ayoko est une femme âgé(e) de 43 ans. Elle est mariée à un employé. Elle a 01 enfant âgé de 16ans qui est scolarisé. Ayoko travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes, de biscuits et amuse-gueule au marché depuis 1999. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et sa difficulté est la concurrence sur le marché Ayoko a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des biscuits et des amuse-gueule. Elle veut agrandir le commerce et créer d’autres points de vente puis épargner. Dans les prochaines années, Ayoko voudrait devenir une grossiste, assurer la scolarisation de son enfant et avoir une famille aisée.
texts.en: Ayoko is a 43-year old woman.  She is married to someone who works.  She has one 16-year old child who attends school. Ayoko has worked as a reseller of "pagne" (brightly-colored cloth), cookies, and snacks since 1999. She stocks up in Lome and her challenge is the competition at the market.  Ayoko is asking for her second loan from WAGES in order to buy cookies and snacks.  She wants to grow her business and open other points-of-sale. Then she wants to save.  In the coming years, Ayoko would like to become a wholesaler, to provide an education for her child, and to have a well-off family.

loans.use: to buy cookies and snacks.

loans.name: Djèkafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djèkafo est composé de quatre femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques; Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Kalaban Coro chef lieu de commune dans le cercle de Kati (dans la 2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kalaban Coro. Les membres du groupe font uniquement le petit commerce de poissons frais. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Korotoumou (femme debout en 2ème position sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) est connue dans le marché de Kalaban Coro pour la vente des poissons frais de toutes les espèces et de tous les calibres. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 150 kg de poissons frais avec les pêcheurs au bord du fleuve Niger à Kabala.  La revente se fait en détails au marché de Kalaban Coro à une clientèle mixte. Madame Korotoumou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, elle désire pérenniser son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The Djekafo Group consists of four married women who are mostly in polygamous households.  They have an average age of 44 and six children.  They all live in the village of Kalaban Coro, the main commune in the Kati circle (in the second largest administrative region of Mali).  The know each other through neighborhood ties and their revenue-generating businesses at the Kalaban Coro market. The group members are exclusively in the business of fresh fish.  In order to increase their working capital, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan.  Ms. Korotoumou (second woman from left to right in the photo) is known at the Kalaban Coro market for the sale of fresh fish of all species and all sizes.  She plans to use her loan to buy 150 kg of fresh fish from the fisherman along the Niger river in Kabala, Retail resale will take place at the Kalaban Coro market to a mix of customers. With this loan, Ms. Korotoumou expects to earn an average monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA that will be reinvested in her business.  Like all the other group members, she wants to sustain her business in partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Juan Jesus

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de 22 años de edad, es padre de un pequeño de 3 años de edad, al que quiere mucho y por el cual trabaja muy duro para salir adelante. Juan trabaja en un empresa textil de su ciudad, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable.

Juan está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar ladrillos, cemento, fierro, entre otros materiales para seguir construyendo su vivienda de material noble, de esta manera le dará una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo y terminar de construir su casa”.
texts.en:
Juan, 22, is a young man and the father of a three-year-old son who he loves very much and who he works hard for to get ahead.  Juan works in a textile factory in his city, around nine hours a day.  He believes he is doing well because he is very responsible.

Juan is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he can buy bricks, cement, iron and other materials to continue building a solid home.  This will give his family a better quality of life and allow him to strive toward his greatest goal:  "To give his son a career and build their house".

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Siguidia est composé de deux femmes mariées polygamiques et deux monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 49 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Kalaban Coro chef lieu de commune dans le cercle de Kati (dans la 2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kalaban Coro. Les membres du groupe font tous le commerce de poissons frais. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Safiatou (femme assise  en 2ème position sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) est connue dans le marché de Kalaban Coro pour la vente des poissons frais de toutes les espèces et de tous les calibres. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 150 kg de poissons frais avec les pêcheurs au bord du fleuve Niger à Kabala.  La revente se fait en détail à Kalaban Coro à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Safiatou compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants. Madame Safiatou désire augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The Siguidia Group consists of two married polygamous women and two monogamous women.  They have an average age of 49 and five children.  They all live in the village of Kalaban Coro, the main commune in the Kati circle (in the second largest administrative region of Mali).  The know each other through their revenue-generating businesses at the Kalaban Coro market. The group members are all in the business of fresh fish.  In order to increase their working capital, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan.  Ms. Safiatou (second woman sitting from left to right in the photo) is known at the Kalaban Coro market for the sale of fresh fish of all species and all sizes.  She plans to use her loan to buy 150 kg of fresh fish from the fisherman along the Niger river in Kabala, Retail resale will take place at the Kalaban Coro market to mostly female customers. With this loan, Ms. Safiatou expects to earn an average monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA that will be reinvested in her business and used to take care of the needs of her children.  Ms. Safiatou wants to increase the volume of her business in this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish.
